column1: EVTDESC46301;In 1894 the Paulista Charles Miller came back from England
column2: where he had studied
column3: with two footballs
column4: a book of rules
column5: a set of uniforms and the experience of having learned the sport invented by the English. Miller and other English resident in São Paulo played the first match in Brazil in 1895
column6: with the employees of the Gas Company playing against employees of the São Paulo Railway. The match was played in the valley of Carmo
column7: and the employees of the railroad company won 4-2. Since then
column8: the interest of Brazilians for the sport has increased dramatically.;En 1894
column9: après ses études
column10: Charles Miller est revenu d'Angleterre
column11: avec deux ballons de football
column12: un livre de règles
column13: un ensemble d'uniformes et avec l'expérience d'avoir appris ce sport inventé par les Anglais. Miller et les autres résidents anglais de São Paulo ont alors joué le premier match du Brésil en 1895
column14: bientôt suivis des employés de la compagnie du gaz jouant contre les employés du chemin de fer de São Paulo. Le match s'est joué dans la vallée de Carmo
column15: et les employés de la compagnie du chemin de fer ont gagné 4 à 2. Depuis lors
column16: l'intérêt des Brésiliens pour ce sport a augmenté de façon spectaculaire.;1894 kam Charles Miller von seinem Studienaufenthalt in England mit zwei Fußbällen
column17: einem Regelbuch
column18: einem Satz Uniformen und der Erfahrung zurück
column19: Fußball im Mutterland des Fußballs gelernt zu haben. Mit anderen englischen Einwohnern Sao Paulos bestritt Miller 1895 das erste Fußballspiel in Brasilien: Angestellte einer Gasfabrik spielten gegen Angehörige der Sao Paulo-Eisenbahn. Das Spiel wurde im Carmo-Tal ausgetragen und die Bahnangehörigen gewannen 4 zu 2. Seit damals hat sich das Interesse der Brasilianer für den Fußballsport dramatisch ausgeweitet.;O Jogo bonito;En 1894

Le parti au pouvoir fasciste a transformé notre nation d'une démocratie à une dictature. ;Das Wahlrecht wurde eingeschränkt und das Parteiensystem gerät mehr und mehr unter staatliche Kontrolle. Erst gestern wurde ein Gesetz zur Erweiterung der Staatsmacht verabschiedet. Die Zeichen sind klar und eindeutig. Die faschistische Regierungspartei hat unsere Nation von einer Demokratie in eine faschistische Diktatur verwandelt.;;El derecho a voto ha sido restringido
column10: el sistema de partidos deriva gradualmente hacia el control estatal
column11: y
column12: justo ayer
column13: se aprobó en la cámara un proyecto de ley sobre la ampliación de los poderes extraordinarios del estado. Los síntomas son clarísimos. El partido fascista gobernante ha transformado nuestra nación de una democracia a una dictadura fascista.;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC60040;Your Majesty
column2: on account of the unstable parliamentary situation
column3: we see no other option than to declare a restoration of the crown to the principles of absolute monarchy. The principles and documents of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ constitutionalism are
column4: effective immediately
column5: declared null and void. Long live the king!;Votre majesté
column6: en raison de l'instabilité de la situation parlementaire
column7: nous ne voyons pas d'autre choix que de déclarer une restauration de la couronne de monarchie absolue. Les principes et documents officiels du constitutionnalisme $COUNTRY_ADJ$ sont
column8: immédiatement
column9: déclarés nuls et non avenus. Longue vie au roi ! ;Eure Majestät
column10: aufgrund des instabilen Parlaments sehen wir keine andere Möglichkeit
column11: als die Wiedereinsetzung der Krone und die Wiederherstellung der Prinzipien der absolutistischen Monarchie zu verkünden. Die Prinzipien und Dokumenten des $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Konstitutionalismus sind ab sofort ungültig. Lang lebe der König!;;Majestad
column12: debido a la inestable situación parlamentaria
column13: no vemos otra opción que declarar un restablecimiento de la corona a los principios de la monarquía absoluta. La leyes y documentos constitucionales de $COUNTRY$ quedan abolidos con efecto. ¡Larga vida al rey!;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC60050;The dictatorship is not what it used to be. Increased pluralism
column2: combined with extended political reforms
column3: have led to the dictatorship more and more taking on the trappings of a democracy. While this doesn't necessarily mean that the party has given up it's reign on power
column4: it does mean that the opposition now has some chance of making its voice heard.;La dictature n'est plus ce qu'elle était. Un pluralisme croissant
column5: combiné avec des réformes politiques étendues
column6: ont conduit la dictature
column7: petit à petit
column8: à prendre des allures de démocratie. Bien que cela ne signifie pas nécessairement que le parti a renoncé à son règne sur le pouvoir
column9: cela veut dire
column10: par contre
column11: que l'opposition a désormais des chances de faire entendre sa voix.;Die Diktatur ist nicht mehr
column12: was sie einmal war. Verstärkter Pluralismus hat zusammen mit ausgedehnten politischen Reformen dazu geführt
column13: dass die Diktator mehr und mehr die Züge einer Demokratie annimmt. Während dies nicht unbedingt heißen muss
column14: dass die Partei ihre Regierungsgewalt aufgibt
column15: so bedeutet es doch
column16: dass die Opposition nun eine nicht unerhebliche Chance hat
column17: sich Gehör zu verschaffen.;;La dictadura ya no es lo que era. El incremento del pluralismo
column18: combinado con amplias reformas políticas
column19: ha llevado a la dictadura a caer progresivamente en los modos de una democracia. Aunque ello no signifique necesariamente que el partido haya perdido su reinado en el poder
column20: significa que ahora la oposición tiene alguna posibilidad de hacer oír su voz.;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA60050;Liberty!;Liberté !;Freiheit!;;¡Libertad!;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTNAME60060;Limited Constitutionalism;Constitutionnalisme limité;Eingeschränkter Konstitutionalismus;;Constitucionalismo limitado;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC60060;The political reforms enacted in the past few years have led to a situation where the absolutism of our Monarchy can now legitimately be called into question. No longer is the king free to dictate the course of the nation to his own musings
column2: but instead has had to accept several constitutional hems and restrictions on his exercise of power. For these reasons
column3: our government form is no longer most accurately described as an absolute monarchy.;Les réformes politiques adoptées au cours des dernières années ont conduit à une situation où l'absolutisme de notre monarchie peut aujourd'hui être légitimement remis en question. Ce n'est plus au roi de librement dicter le cours de la nation suivant ses rêveries
column4: mais à lui de plutôt devoir accepter plusieurs ourlets constitutionnels et des restrictions sur son exercice du pouvoir. Pour ces raisons
column5: notre forme de gouvernement n'est plus
column6: exactement
column7: décrivable comme une monarchie absolue. ;Die in den letzten Jahren durchgeführten politischen Reformen haben zu einer Situation geführt
column8: in der der Absolutismus unserer Monarchie nun legitim in Frage gestellt werden kann. Der König kann die Geschicke der Nation nicht mehr nach eigenem Gutdünken lenken
column9: sondern muss sich bei der Ausübung seiner Macht an bestimmte Verfassungsgrundsätze halten. Aus diesem Grund kann unsere Regierungsform nicht mehr als absolute Monarchie beschrieben werden.;;Las reformas políticas promulgadas durante los últimos años han llevado a una situación en la que el absolutismo de nuestro monarca puede ser cuestionado de forma legítima. El rey ya no puede trazar el curso de la nación a su antojo
column10: sino que ha tenido que aceptar varias enmiendas y restricciones constitucionales en el ejercicio de su poder. Por dichas razones
column11: la forma más precisa de llamar a nuestro gobierno ya no es la de monarquía absoluta.;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA60060;It is only right and good;Ce n'est que justice;Das ist nur recht und billig.;;Es justo y necesario;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTNAME60070;Extended Constitutionalism;Constitutionnalisme étendu;Ausgeweiterter Konstitutionalismus;;Constitucionalismo ampliado;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC60070;The sweeping reforms to our party system that have been enacted during the past few years have turned our country from an absolute monarchy to a constitutional monarchy. The Monarch
column2: now serving as a symbolic head-of-state
column3: no longer has the power to personally control and determine the fate of the nation
column4: but is instead forced to accept the mitigating influences of pluralism and limited democracy.;Les réformes en profondeur de notre système de partis qui ont été promulguées
column5: au cours des dernières années
column6: ont transformé notre pays d'une monarchie absolue à une monarchie constitutionnelle. Le monarque
column7: servant actuellement en tant que chef-symbolique de l'état
column8: n'a plus le pouvoir de personnellement contrôler et déterminer le sort de la nation
column9: mais est plutôt contraint d'accepter l'influence atténuante du pluralisme et de la démocratie limitée. ;Die dramatischen Reformen unseres Parteiensystems während der letzten Jahre haben unser Land von einer absoluten Monarche in eine konstitutionelle Monarche verwandelt. Der Monarch fungiert nun mehr lediglich als symbolisches Staatsoberhaupt und hat keine Möglichkeit mehr
column10: das Land persönlich zu kontrollieren und über sein Schicksal zu entscheiden. Stattdessen ist er gezwungen
column11: die mildernden Einflüsse des Pluralismus und eingeschränkter Demokratie zu akzeptieren.;;Las arrolladoras reformas hacia un sistema de partidos que se han llevado a cabo durante los últimos años han hecho que nuestro país pase a ser de una monarquía absoluta a una monarquía constitucional. El monarca
column12: que ahora sirve de cabeza de estado simbólica
column13: ya no tiene el poder de controlar y determinar personalmente el destino de la nación
column14: sino que está obligado a aceptar las influencias atenuantes del pluralismo y de una democracia limitada.;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA60070;Long Live The King!;Longue vie au roi ! ;Lang lebe der König!;;¡Larga vida al rey!;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTNAME60080;The Road to Serfdom;La route du servage;Der Weg in die Leibeigenschaft;;Camino de servidumbre;;;;;;;;;x;
EVTDESC60080;Lately an eerie feeling has crept over you that $COUNTRY$ is growing silent. Where before the free exchange of opinion and ideas could be heard
column2: from street corners and bus stops to bars and universities
column3: now only the sounds of silence gives echo. The conclusion that is becoming ever more evident
column4: is that the tradition of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ democracy has been subverted. In $COUNTRY$
column5: at least
column6: the government for
column7: of and by the people
column8: has perished from the earth.;Vous avez récemment eu la désagréable impression de voir $COUNTRY$ sombrer dans le silence. Là où chacun pouvait autrefois s'exprimer librement
column9: aussi bien dans les rues que dans les bars ou sur les bancs des universités
column10: un silence pesant règne désormais. La conclusion est plus qu'évidente : la tradition démocratique $COUNTRY_ADJ$ a disparu. En $COUNTRY$
column11: au moins
column12: la gouvernance populaire a disparu.;In letzter Zeit hat Sie ein unheimliches Gefühl befallen
column13: denn aus $COUNTRY$ hört man nichts mehr. Wo vorher freie Meinungsäußerung herrschte und an Straßenecken
column14: Bushaltestellen
column15: in Bars und Universitäten Ideen diskutiert wurden
column16: herrscht nun Totenstille. Es wird immer offensichtlicher
column17: dass die traditionelle $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Demokratie unterwandert worden ist. Zumindest in $COUNTRY$ ist die Regierung des Volkes wie vom Erdboden verschwunden.;;Últimamente
column18: te ha asaltado la extraña sensación de que un creciente silencio se ha adueñado de $COUNTRY$. Donde antes se podía oír el libre intercambio de opiniones e ideas
column19: desde las esquinas y las paradas de autobuses hasta los bares y las universidades
column20: ahora solo resuenan los ecos del silencio. La conclusión que se hace cada vez más evidente es que la democracia $COUNTRY_ADJ$ está en entredicho. En $COUNTRY$
column21: al menos
column22: el gobierno del pueblo y para el pueblo se ha esfumado.;;;;;;;;;x;

column1: EVTOPTA60080;Muahahaha!;Mouah ha ha ha !;Muahahaha!;;¡Muahahaha!;;;;;;;;;x;
EVTNAME60120;Increasing Federalism;Fédéralisme en hausse;Steigender Föderalismus;;Federalismo en auge;;;;;;;;;x;;
EVTDESC60120;A sentiment of cultural nationalism is sweeping $COUNTRY$
column2: as people begin to clamor for unification with our cultural brethren in $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$. We have little reason to doubt that they would object to a petition of annexation.;Un sentiment de nationalisme culturel déferle sur $COUNTRY$ et les gens commencent à appeler à l'unification avec nos frères culturels de $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$. Nous avons peu de raison de douter qu'ils s'opposeront à une pétition d'annexion.;In der gesamten Bevölkerung von $COUNTRY$ macht sich kultureller Nationalismus breit. Das Volk schreit nach der Vereinigung mit unseren kulturellen Brüdern in $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$. Wir haben kaum Zweifel daran
column3: dass sie einer Anschlusspetition zustimmen würden.;;Un sentimiento de nacionalismo cultural está recorriendo $COUNTRY$. La gente empieza a demandar la unificación con nuestros parientes culturales del estado conocido como $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$. No creemos que pudieran oponerse a una petición de anexión.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA60120;Let's do it;Allons-y;Machen wir;;Hagámoslo.;;;;;;;;;x;;
EVTNAME60130;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Petitions for Annexation;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Pétitions d'annexion;$FROMCOUNTRY$s Anschlusspetition;;Peticiones de anexión desde $FROMCOUNTRY$;;;;;;;;;x;;
EVTDESC60130;Following a surge in popular nationalist sentiments
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has placed a formal request with our authorities in $CAPITAL$ that they be allowed to join $COUNTRY$ in perpetual union. There seems to be little reason to oppose this move.;À la suite d'une montée de sentiments nationalistes
column3: le gouvernement $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ a formulé une demande officielle auprès de nos autorités de $CAPITAL$ pour les autoriser à rejoindre $COUNTRY$ dans le cadre d'une union perpétuelle. Il n'existe apparemment aucune raison de s'opposer à ce mouvement.;Nach einem Aufwogen nationalistischer Strömungen in der Bevölkerung hat die $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$e Regierung unseren Behörden in $CAPITAL$ einen formalen Antrag überreicht
column4: sich $COUNTRY$ in einer in dauerhaften Union anschließen zu dürfen. Es bestehen wohl kaum Gründe
column5: sich diesem Schritt zu verweigern.;;Atendiendo al auge de sentimientos nacionalistas en la población
column6: el gobierno de $FROMCOUNTRY$ ha cursado una solicitud formal a nuestras autoridades en $CAPITAL$ que le permitiría unirse a $COUNTRY$ de forma permanente. No parece haber razón para oponerse a tal maniobra.;;;;;;;;;x;;

column3: well at least everyone who truly matters
column4: will be represented in this new gathering to shape the path of our nation.;Alors que les libéraux tiennent les rênes de notre pays

column6: du moins de tous ceux qui importent vraiment
column7: seront représentées dans cette nouvelle assemblée afin de forger la voie de nos nations.;Die Liberalen haben unser Land fest im Griff
column8: und sie glauben
column9: dass es jetzt an der Zeit für eine konstitutionelle Verfassung ist. In dieser neuen Verfassung
column10: die den zukünftigen Weg unserer Nation eben wird
column11: werden die Meinungen aller repräsentiert sein
column12: zumindest jener

column15: creen que ha llegado el momento de organizar una convención constitucional. Todo el mundo (al menos todo el mundo que cuenta) estará representado en esta gran asamblea que dará forma al futuro de nuestro país.;;;;;;;;x  ;

EVTNAME80000;The Convention of Peking;La convention de Pékin;Die Pekinger Konvention;;La convención de Pekín;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC80000;The Russians have demanded that we acquiesce to their theft of our rightful territory. This is outrageous
column2: but we may have no recourse but to accept their demands. If we do
column3: they shall help ensure our sovereignty vis-à-vis the other Europeans. Also
column4: we may be incapable of defeating them if the Russians decide to resolve this issue by force.;Les Russes exigent que nous acquiescions au vol de notre territoire légitime. C’est un outrage
column5: mais nous n’avons pas d’autre choix que de céder à leurs exigences. Si nous cédons
column6: nous assurerons par là notre souveraineté à l’égard des autres européens. De plus
column7: nous serions dans l’incapacité de vaincre si les Russes décidait de résoudre la situation par la force.;Die Russen haben verlangt
column8: dass wir ihren Diebstahl unseres rechtmäßigen Territoriums anerkennen. Dies ist unerhört
column9: aber uns wird vermutlich keine andere Wahl bleiben
column10: als ihren Forderungen zu entsprechen. Falls wir das tun
column11: werden sie uns bei der Behauptung unserer Souveränität den anderen Europäern gegenüber helfen. Sollten sich die Russen entscheiden
column12: diesen Disput mit Waffengewalt zu lösen
column13: würden wir sie vermutlich sowieso nicht schlagen können.;;Los rusos han exigido que reconozcamos lo que es un flagrante robo de nuestro legítimo territorio. Es un ultraje
column14: pero no tenemos más remedio que aceptar sus demandas. Si lo hacemos
column15: garantizarán nuestra soberanía frente a las demás potencias europeas. Además
column16: si decidiéramos oponernos a ellos por la fuerza
column17: tal vez no podríamos derrotarlos.;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC90000;As everyone knows
column2: $CB_TARGET_NAME$ is out to get us. It's only a matter of time before they launch an unprovoked attack
column3: so it is only reasonable that we take steps to pre-emptively defend ourselves. As luck would have it
column4: a report detailing their nefarious schemes has recently been “leaked” to the press
column5: and the public have rallied to our cause.;Comme tout le monde le sait
column6: $CB_TARGET_NAME$ veut nous avoir. Ce n'est qu'une question de temps avant qu'ils lancent une attaque injustifiée
column7: de sorte que la seule attitude raisonnable serait que nous prenions les devants par une attaque préventive. Par chance
column8: un rapport détaillant leurs noirs desseins a récemment été lâché dans la presse
column9: et l'opinion publique a rallié notre cause.;"Jeder weiß
column10: dass $CB_TARGET_NAME$ uns fertig machen will. Es ist nur eine Frage der Zeit
column11: bis sie einen unprovozierten Angriff starten. Deshalb ist es nur vernünftig
column12: dass wir ebenfalls Schritte unternehmen
column13: um uns präventiv zu schützen. Wie es das Glück so will
column14: ist ein Dokument über deren schändlichen Pläne erst kürzlich über die Presse ""durchgesickert"" und die öffentliche Meinung ist zu unseren Gunsten.";;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90000;They're coming right for us!;Ils arrivent bien pour sur nous !;Bald sind sie da!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90001;Mission to $CB_TARGET_NAME$;Mission en $CB_TARGET_NAME$;Mission für $CB_TARGET_NAME$;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90001;In a rather embarrassing blunder
column2: several of our soldiers in the uniform of $CB_TARGET_NAME$ have been caught while trying to sneak across the border. While the rumours that their task was to stage a border incident to justify our invasion are totally unfounded
column3: it would be wise not to provide any fresh fuel for the fire right now.;Suite à une bourde plutôt embarrassante
column4: plusieurs de nos soldats ont été pris alors qu'ils tentaient de se faufiler à travers la frontière
column5: revêtus des uniformes de $CB_TARGET_NAME$. Bien que les rumeurs
column6: selon lesquelles leur tâche était de mettre en scène un incident de frontière pour justifier notre propre invasion
column7: soient dénuées de tout fondement
column8: il serait sage de ne pas jeter de l'huile sur le feu en ce moment.;Bei einem peinlichen Fehlschlag wurden einige unserer Soldaten mit der Uniform von $CB_TARGET_NAME$ bei dem Versuch über die Grenze zu schleichen gefangen genommen. Obwohl die Gerüchte über eine inszenierten Grenzvorfall für eine Rechtfertigung zur Invasion komplett unbegründet sind
column9: wäre es im Moment klug für nicht noch mehr Zündstoff zu sorgen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90001;What are you talking about?;De quoi parlez-vous ?;Wovon redet Ihr da?;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90002;The tyrany of $CB_TARGET_NAME$;La tyrannie de $CB_TARGET_NAME$;Die Tyrannei von $CB_TARGET_NAME$;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC90002;For too long people have suffered under the malign influence of $CB_TARGET_NAME$. For the good of all involved we must reveal the evidence of $CB_TARGET_NAME$'s mismanagement to the world and bring their Sphere members under our wing for their own good.;Depuis trop longtemps la population a subi la mauvaise influence de $CB_TARGET_NAME$. Pour le bien de tous
column2: nous devons mettre au jour la mauvaise gestion de $CB_TARGET_NAME$ et conduire les membres de leur sphère d'influence sous notre aile protectrice
column3: pour leur propre bien.;Zu lange schon mussten die Leute unter dem unheilvollen Einfluss von $CB_TARGET_NAME$ leiden. Zum Wohle aller Beteiligten
column4: müssen wir die Beweise von $CB_TARGET_NAME$s Misswirtschaft der Welt kundtun und die Mitglieder deren Einflussbereichs zu ihren Gunsten unter unsere Fittiche nehmen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90002;We will save them!;Nous allons les sauver !;Wir werden sie retten!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90003;The tyrany of $CB_TARGET_NAME$;La tyrannie de $CB_TARGET_NAME$;Die Tyrannei von $CB_TARGET_NAME$;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC90003;Despite having very much non-made-up proof that $CB_TARGET_NAME$ are up to no good there seems to be no public or international support for rescuing the poor lesser nations from their sphere of influence.;Malgré de nombreuses preuves absolument pas trafiquées contre $CB_TARGET_NAME$
column2: il ne semble pas y avoir de soutien populaire ou international en faveur de notre projet de sortir les pauvres nations rabaissées appartenant à leur sphère d'influence.;Trotz vieler nicht ausgedachter Beweise
column3: dass $CB_TARGET_NAME$ nichts Gutes im Schilde führt
column4: scheint es keine öffentliche und internationale Unterstützung zu geben
column5: die armen
column6: geringeren Nationen aus deren Einflussbereich zu retten. ;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90003;Fools!;Imbéciles !;Dummköpfe!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90004;Protecting the $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$;Protection des $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$;Die $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$ verteidigen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90004;Without the protection of a Great Power such as ourselves anything could happen to $CB_TARGET_NAME$. In order to protect them they must be added to our Sphere of Influence
column2: despite any short-term objections they might have. After all
column3: if they any sense they would be Great powers too.;Sans la protection d'une grande puissance telle la nôtre
column4: tout peut arriver à $CB_TARGET_NAME$. Afin d'être protégés
column5: il faut qu'ils rejoignent notre sphère d'influence en dépit de toutes les objections à courte vue qu'ils peuvent avoir. Après tout
column6: si elles faisaient sens
column7: eux aussi seraient une grande puissance.;Ohne den Schutz einer Großmacht wie uns
column8: könnte $CB_TARGET_NAME$ alles Mögliche wiederfahren. Um sie zu beschützen
column9: müssen sie unserem Einflussbereich hinzugefügt werden
column10: unabhängig von möglichen kurzfristigen Einwänden
column11: die sie haben könnten. Immerhin fehlt ihnen das richtige Gespür für die Daseinsberechtigung als Großmacht.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90004;We're here to help you.;Nous sommes là pour vous aider.;Wir sind hier
column2: um euch zu helfen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME90005;The $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$ Fiasco;Le fiasco $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$;Das $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$ Fiasko;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90005;Although we only want to help $CB_TARGET_NAME$ by adding them to our sphere of influence they have gotten very worked up about it. While unseemly to all involved
column2: their behaviour has rather turned international opinion against forcefully requesting they join us in our prosperity. Although we only want to help $CB_TARGET_NAME$ by adding them to our sphere of influence they have gotten very worked up about it. While unseemly to all involved
column3: their behaviour has rather turned international opinion against forcefully requesting they join us in our prosperity.;Bien que nous voulions seulement aider $CB_TARGET_NAME$ en les intégrant à notre sphère d'influence
column4: cela les a fait réfléchir. Leur comportement a fini par tourner l'opinion internationale contre notre proposition de les faire participer à notre prospérité.;Obwohl wir $CB_TARGET_NAME$ nur helfen wollen
column5: indem wir sie unserem Einflussbereich zuordnen
column6: haben sie sich sehr darüber aufgeregt. Sehr zum Unverständnis aller Involvierten
column7: hat ihr Verhalten internationale Meinungen gegen unsere nachdrückliche Bitte a;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90005;Good call.;Bon plan.;Eine gute Entscheidung.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90006;An end to $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$ Imperialism;Fin de l'impérialisme $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$;Ein Ende dem Imperialismus von $CB_TARGET_NAME_ADJ$ ;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90006;Why should $CB_TARGET_NAME$ get all the prime colonial land? It's downright unfair
column2: that's what it is! They probably aren't even properly exploit- educating the native population! Something must be done
column3: we deserve our place in the sun!;Pourquoi $CB_TARGET_NAME$ devrait avoir la primeur sur toutes les terres coloniales ? C'est plus qu'injuste
column4: voilà tout ! Ils ne sont probablement même pas capables d'exploiter -d'éduquer- convenablement la population autochtone ! Quelque chose doit être fait
column5: nous méritons notre place au soleil !;Warum sollte $CB_TARGET_NAME$ all die guten Kolonien bekommen? Das ist hochgradig ungerecht und sonst nichts! Vermutlich schaffen sie es nicht einmal
column6: die einheimische Bevölkerung richtig auszubeuten.. zu unterrichten. Es muss etwas getan werden. Wir verdienen einen Platz an der Sonne.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90006;Good call.;Bon plan.;Eine gute Entscheidung.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90007;Colonial Setback;Recul colonial;Kolonialer Rückschlag;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90007;Despite the modest nature of our just demands
column2: there seems to be no international support for re-adjusting the colonial balance between ourselves and $CB_TARGET_NAME$. While this is a setback
column3: we have no doubt that one day we will possess and empire that the sun never sets on.;En dépit de la nature modeste de nos justes demandes
column4: il ne semble pas y avoir de consensus international pour réajuster l'équilibre colonial entre $CB_TARGET_NAME$ et nous. Malgré cet échec
column5: nous ne doutons pas de posséder un jour un empire sur lequel le soleil ne se couchera jamais.;Trotz der moderaten Natur unserer Forderungen scheint es keine internationale Unterstützung zu geben
column6: um die koloniale Balance zwischen uns und $CB_TARGET_NAME$ wieder herzustellen. Obwohl dies ein Rückschlag ist
column7: haben wir keine Zweifel daran
column8: dass wir dies eines Tages korrigieren werden auf das in unserem Reich die Sonne niemals untergeht.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90007;Good call.;Bon plan;Eine gute Entscheidung.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90008;Its time to act!;Il est temps d'agir !;Es ist Zeit
column2: zu handeln!;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90008;$CB_TARGET_NAME$ is getting too big for their boots
column2: as all can agree. For too long they have been strutting around the world stage
column3: thinking they can do as they will. Thankfully
column4: at last the rest of the world agrees
column5: and our population is solidly behind us: $CB_TARGET_NAME$ must be taken down a peg or two.;$CB_TARGET_NAME$ devient trop gros pour ses bottes
column6: tout le monde en convient. Pendant trop longtemps
column7: ils se sont pavanés sur de la scène mondiale
column8: pensant qu'ils pouvaient faire ce qu'ils voulaient. Heureusement
column9: le reste du monde est au moins d'accord avec nous
column10: et notre population est fermement derrière nous : $CB_TARGET_NAME$ doit être rétrogradé d'un rang ou deux.;$CB_TARGET_NAME$ wird zu groß für deren Schuhgröße
column11: wie alle zustimmen können. Schon viel zu lang sind sie über die Weltbühne stolziert und dachten
column12: dass sie alles tun und lassen können
column13: wie es ihnen gefällt. Glücklicherweise stimmt uns der Rest der Welt endlich zu und unsere gesamte Bevölkerung steht klar hinter uns : $CB_TARGET_NAME$ muss um ein oder zwei Stufen runtergeholt werden.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90008;Good call.;Bon plan.;Eine gute Entscheidung.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90009;Misguided fools!;Ce sont des égarés !;Fehlgeleitete Dummköpfe!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90009;While the hubris of $CB_TARGET_NAME$ is evident to us
column2: apparently others fail to see it. Their so-called “sovereignty” apparently allows them to have their own army and to do as they will without deferring to us. It has even been implied that we are the arrogant ones!;Alors que l'orgueil de $CB_TARGET_NAME$ est évident pour nous
column3: il semble que les autres ne le voient pas. Leur soi-disant souveraineté leur permet apparemment d'avoir leur propre armée et de faire ce qu'ils veulent sans en référer à nous. On a même laissé entendre que nous serions arrogants !;"Obwohl der Größenwahn von $CB_TARGET_NAME$  absolut offensichtlich für uns ist
column4: teilen andere scheinbar unseren Blickwinkel nicht. Ihre sogenannte ""Souveränität"" erlaubt es ihnen anscheinend
column5: ihre eigene Armee zu haben und zu machen
column6: was sie wollen

column1: EVTOPTA90009;Good call.;Bon plan.;Eine gute Entscheidung.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90040;The Sepoy Rebellion;;Der Sepoyaufstand;;;;;;;;;;;x;
EVTDESC90040;India has risen in rebellion!;;Indien erhebt sich in Rebellion!;;;;;;;;;;;x;
EVTOPTA90040;This could mean trouble.;;Das bedeutet Ärger.;;;;;;;;;;;x;
EVTNAME90100;Longing for a Free Press;En faveur de la liberté de la presse;Sehnsucht nach Pressefreiheit;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90102;Longing for Public Meetings;En faveur de la liberté de réunion;Sehnsucht nach Versammlungsfreiheit;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90104;Longing for Trade Unions;En faveur des syndicats;Sehnsucht nach Handelsgewerkschaften;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90100;The People long for a Free Press
column2: and as our neighbours adopt this reform it makes their longing all the stronger.;Le peuple est en faveur de la liberté de la presse. Nos voisins ayant adopté cette réforme
column3: son désir est d'autant plus fort.;Die Bevölkerung sehnt sich nach Pressefreiheit
column4: und je mehr unserer Nachbarn diese Reform annehmen
column5: umso stärker wird dieses Verlangen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90100;Perhaps we can work something out;Peut-être pourra-t-on en tirer quelque chose !;Vielleicht können wir uns einigen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB90100;Never!;Jamais !;Niemals!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90102;The People long for the right to Public Meetings
column2: and as our neighbours adopt this reform it makes their longing all the stronger. ;Le peuple est en faveur de la liberté de réunion. Nos voisins ayant adopté cette réforme
column3: son désir est d'autant plus fort. ;Die Bevölkerung sehnt sich nach Versammlungsfreiheit
column4: und je mehr unserer Nachbarn diese Reform annehmen
column5: umso stärker wird dieses Verlangen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90104;The People long for Trade Unions
column2: and as our neighbours adopt this reform it makes their longing all the stronger. ;Le peuple est en faveur des syndicats. Nos voisins ayant adopté cette réforme
column3: son désir est d'autant plus fort. ;Die Bevölkerung sehnt sich nach Handelsgewerkschaften
column4: und je mehr unserer Nachbarn diese Reform annehmen
column5: umso stärker wird dieses Verlangen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME90101;Broken promises;Promesses non tenues;Gebrochene Versprechen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90101;Despite our promise to reform the press
column2: nothing has changed and the people are somewhat upset.;En dépit de notre promesse de réformer la presse
column3: rien n'a changé et les gens sont quelque peu déçus.;Trotz unseres Versprechens
column4: die Presse zu reformieren
column5: hat sich nichts verändert und die Bevölkerung ist ein wenig aufgebracht.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90101;How depressing;Comme c'est déprimant;Wie niederschmetternd;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90103;Despite our promise to allow public meetings
column2: nothing has changed and the people are somewhat upset.;En dépit de notre promesse de permettre la liberté de réunion
column3: rien n'a changé et les gens sont quelque peu déçus.;Trotz unseres Versprechens
column4: Versammlungsfreiheit zu erlauben
column5: hat sich nichts verändert und die Bevölkerung ist ein wenig aufgebracht.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90103;I hate crowds;Je déteste les foules;Ich hasse Menschenmengen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90105;Despite our promise to allow trade unions
column2: nothing has changed and the people are somewhat upset.;En dépit de notre promesse de permettre l'existence des syndicats
column3: rien n'a changé et les gens sont quelque peu déçus;Trotz unseres Versprechens
column4: Handelsgewerkschaften zu erlauben
column5: hat sich nichts verändert und die Bevölkerung ist ein wenig aufgebracht.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90105;Better dead than red!;Mieux vaut morts que rouges !;Besser tot als rot!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90900;The Middle Kingdom;L'empire du Milieu;Das Königreich der Mitte;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90900;"We are now sufficently advanced for the European barbarians to regard us as ""Civilised""
column2: and so they must respect our right to centralise and reject foreign influence throughout China.";Nous sommes suffisamment avancés pour que les barbares européens nous considèrent comme civilisés. Ainsi
column3: ils doivent respecter notre droit à centraliser et à rejeter les influences étrangères à travers la Chine.;"Wir sind nun ausreichend fortgeschritten
column4: damit die europäischen Barbaren uns als ""zivilisiert"" betrachten
column5: nun müssen sie daher unser Recht auf Zentralisierung und die Ablehnung des ausländischen Einflusses in China anerkennen.";;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90900;We are united again;Nous sommes à nouveau unis;Wir sind wieder vereint;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90901;The Qing's new status has lead them to demand we submit to their authority
column2: accepting will mean an end to our independant existence.;Le nouveau statuts des Qing les a conduit à nous demander de nous soumettre à leur autorité. Accepter sonnera le glas de notre indépendance.;Der neue Status der Qing hat sie dazu verleitet von uns zu verlangen
column3: sich ihrer Autorität zu unterwerfen. Wenn wir annehmen
column4: bedeutet dies das Ende unserer unabhängigen Existenz.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA90901;We are united again;Nous sommes à nouveau unis;Wir sind wieder vereint;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90902;The Breakup of China;;Der Zerfall Chinas;;;;;;;;;;;x;
EVTDESC90902;China has fractured.;;China bricht auseinander.;;;;;;;;;;;x;
EVTOPTA90902;Freedom!;;Freiheit!;;;;;;;;;;;x;
EVTOPTA90910;Wagons West!;Wagons à l'ouest !;Wagen gen Westen!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME90950;Assets seized! ;Biens saisis !;Anlagevermögen beschlagnahmt!;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC90950;The ungrateful government of $FROMCOUNTRY$ has sized our investments and claimed them as their own!;Le gouvernement ingrat de $FROMCOUNTRY$ a saisi nos investissements et les a revendiqués comme siens !;Die undankbare Regierung von $FROMCOUNTRY$ hat unsere Investitionen beschlagnahmt und beansprucht sie für sich selbst!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA90950;This shall not stand! ;Ça ne durera pas !;Damit wird man nicht durchkommen!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB90950;Let them be;Laissons faire;Lasst sie in Ruhe;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME95500;The $CAPITAL$ Conference of $YEAR$;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC95500;The colonial powers of the world have gathered in $CAPITAL$ to discuss the regulation of colonization and trade in Africa. The outcome has become known as the 'General Act of the $CAPITAL$ Conference'
column2: formalizing the scramble for the African continent. After this point
column3: any civilized country will largely be seen as justified in aggression towards uncivilized African nations.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME95501;The Scramble for Africa;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC95501;A conference has been held in $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: attended by all colonial powers
column3: to discuss the regulation of colonization and trade in Africa. A general agreement has been reached
column4: formalizing the scramble for the African continent. After this point
column5: any civilized country will largely be seen as justified in aggression towards uncivilized African nations.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME95505;The Scramble for Africa;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC95505;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence is felt throughout Africa
column2: and some members of the government are suggesting we should press for more direct control over native African governments. Without $COUNTRY_ADJ$ protection
column3: it's very likely that these people would fall under the sway of a competing colonial power
column4: and is it not our moral imperative to extend the benefits that true civilization can offer?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME95506;The Scramble for Africa;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC95506;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence is felt everywhere in $COUNTRY$. They come to us
column2: saying they will bring education and civilization. We know what they really want: all the wealth of $COUNTRY$ in their coffers. But what can we do? Now they wish to govern us more directly-- for our 'protection' from other ambitious foreign powers. If we agree
column3: our way of life is over. If we refuse
column4: they will make war upon us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME95507;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Has Refused;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC95507;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ people have made a foolhardy decision: they have refused our offer of protection and have gone so far as to eject our representatives from the country. There are even reports of several deaths. It seems we are left with no choice but to march into $FROMCOUNTRY$ and force them to see the proper path.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96000;War is Upon Us;La Guerre c'est Ici;Der Krieg Kommt;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96000;$COUNTRY$ is in a state of total war with one of the Great Powers of the world. In a modern age where warfare has the capability of killing millions
column2: the very future of our nation could be at stake. The call has gone out to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people: put aside your petty differences
column3: your day-to-day lives and your personal ambitions. $COUNTRY$ must pull together in this, our hour of need!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96000;We shall be victorious!;Nous serons victorieux!;Wir sind siegreich!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96010;The Treaty of $CAPITAL$;Le Traité de $CAPITAL$;Der Vertrag von $CAPITAL$;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96010;We have lost the war
column2: and like vultures the victors have descended upon us. We have been forced to the bargaining table to accept humiliating terms regarding the breakup of our empire
column3: with many of our lands simply given away
column4: and we shall be permitted no overseas holdings whatsoever. This is a moment that shall be remembered in $COUNTRY$ for years to come.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96004;The Demands of War;Les Demandes de la Guerre;Die Nachfragen des Krieges;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC96004;The constant state of war $COUNTRY$ is under has taken its toll on our people. Shortages of basic goods and the failure to deliver swift victory have worn down the enthusiasm with which the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people initially greeted the war effort. If things don't turn around soon
column2: we could face growing weariness and unrest within our own borders.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96004;We will win this war!;Nous gagnerons la guerre!;Wir gewinnen den Krieg!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96005;Is It All For Nothing?;Est-il Tout Pour Rien?;Ist Alles Für Nichts?;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96005;Growing demonstrations in $CAPITAL$ demonstrate the prevailing attitude of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people: get us out of the war
column2: and soon. Too many have been lost
column3: too many sacrifices made
column4: and all for what? The people wish to go back to their regular lives
column5: without the constant spectre of war hanging over their heads.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96005;Do not lose hope!;Ne perdez pas l'espoir!;Verlieren Sie nicht Hoffnung!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96006;Total Collapse;Effondrement Total;Gesamteinsturz;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96006;The war effort is not going well
column2: to put it lightly. Advisors are saying that $COUNTRY$ should sue for peace
column3: do whatever it takes to end this war before something even more terrible happens. The people are on the brink of revolt. We must act!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96006;Disaster!;Désastre!;Unfall!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA96010;We welcome peace;La paix est bienvenue;Frieden ist willkommen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96013;The Breakup of $FROMCOUNTRY$;La Dissolution de $FROMCOUNTRY$;Das Auseinanderbrechen von $FROMCOUNTRY$;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96013;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been forced to concede defeat in its war
column2: and we have been invited to the negotiating table to discuss the potential breakup of their empire. This could potentially mean we see $COUNTRY_ADJ$ lands returned to us
column3: though if we forego our claims it could mean salvaging a relationship with $FROMCOUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96013;We will attend the talks;Nous joindrons les entretiens;Wir gehen zu den Gesprächen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96013;We will not attend;Nous n'irons pas;Wir gehen nicht;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96014;The Breakup of $FROMCOUNTRY$;La Dissolution de $FROMCOUNTRY$;Das Auseinanderbrechen von $FROMCOUNTRY$;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96014;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been forced to concede defeat in its war
column2: and now treaty talks have begun to discuss the breakup of their empire. As an enemy of $FROMCOUNTRY$
column3: our place at the table is assured. At the very least
column4: any $COUNTRY_ADJ$ lands currently in $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ possession should be returned.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96014;We simply wish our lands back;Nous voulons nos terres;Wir wünschen unsere Länder;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96015;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Freedom;Liberté $COUNTRY_ADJ$;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Freiheit;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96015;The defeat of $FROMCOUNTRY$ in their war has forced them to the negotiating table
column2: and one of the terms for the breakup of their empire is our release from their direct rule. This would mean casting out $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ officials and potentially turning them into an enemy. We could maintain our close ties with $FROMCOUNTRY$ even with our freedom
column3: though this would mean passing up a chance for freedom and goodwill from $FROMCOUNTRY$'s enemies.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96015;$COUNTRY$ shall be free;$COUNTRY$ sera libre;$COUNTRY$ ist frei;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96015;$FROMCOUNTRY$ is our ally;$FROMCOUNTRY$ est notre allié;$FROMCOUNTRY$ ist unser Verbündetes;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96016;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonies;Les Colonies $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$;Das $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Kolonien;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96016;One of the matters discussed at the treaty talks is what to do with $FROMCOUNTRY$'s colonial holdings. They should not be allowed to keep these lands
column2: but determinining how they should be disposed of is no simple matter. For now
column3: agreement has been reached determining some of the territory
column4: and any remaining will have to be negotiated over in the coming year.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96016;We will take what we can;Nous voulons autant que possible;Wir wünschen so viel wie möglich;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96016;Our only interest is limiting $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ power;Nous voulons seulement;Wir wünschen nur wenig;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC96016;We have no interest in their colonies;Nous ne voulons pas les colonies;Wir wünschen nicht die Kolonien;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96017;One of the matters discussed at the treaty talks is what to do with $FROMCOUNTRY$'s colonial holdings. We are not a great power
column2: and it's possible that even if pursue some of their colonies for our own we'll end up with nothing... but if we do not try
column3: we'll end up with nothing for sure. Even so
column4: making the attempt could be seen as aggressive.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96020;The War is Over;La Guerre c'est Finie;Der Krieg ist Fertig;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96020;With the war finished
column2: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have taken to the streets of $CAPITAL$ in celebration. The toll of the war has been heavy
column3: but today $COUNTRY$ is simply happy to be at peace.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96020;Long live $COUNTRY$!;Vive $COUNTRY$!;Lieben lang $COUNTRY$!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96022;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been created from the ether
column2: but the powers-that-be have determined at least some of their lands rightfully belong to $COUNTRY$ and should be returned to us. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have rejoiced at this news.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96025;Enemy of my Enemy;Ennemi de mon Ennemi;Feind meines Feindes;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96025;Now that we are in a state of total war
column2: the idea has arisen that $COUNTRY$ should approach $FROMCOUNTRY$'s enemies to see if there are those who would join our side against them. This may mean an unholy alliance with those who might never fight at our side otherwise
column3: but as the old saying goes: 'The enemy of my enemy is my friend.' If we are to win the war against $FROMCOUNTRY$
column4: we may have to take that to heart.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96025;Do it;Oui;Ja;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96025;We don't need more allies;Nous n'avons pas besoin de plus d'alliés;Wir benötigen nicht mehr Verbündete;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96030;The Shadow of War;L'ombre de la Guerre;Der Schatten des Krieges;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96030;A diplomat from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached us with a proposal: an alliance with them
column2: to fight in a war against their enemy... who is certainly no friend of ours. While the alliance does not necessarily obligate us
column3: the question really remains whether or not $COUNTRY$ even wishes to go to war. If we fight with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column4: we stand the chance of gaining the spoils of war for ourselves. It also means we could fall with them. The choice is ours.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96030;We will ally with $FROMCOUNTRY$;Nous convenons;Wir stimmen zu;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96030;We refuse;Nous refusons;Wir lehnen ab;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96031;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Has Agreed;$FROMCOUNTRY$ a Convenu;$FROMCOUNTRY$ hat Zugestimmt;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC96031;We have received word from $FROMCOUNTRY$ that they have agreed to an alliance. Whether or not they will actually live up to that alliance and join us in the war remains to be seen.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA96031;Great;Excellent;Ausgezeichnet;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96065;Outrage!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96065;A diplomatic incident with one of our enemies has outraged $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens. Several weeks ago
column2: an envoy assigned to $CAPITAL$ was accused of stealing national secrets. It turned out the truth was far worse
column3: and an investigation has unearthed a conspiracy to destablize $COUNTRY$ and leave it week for invasion. This has leaked out to the public
column4: and now crowds in the capital are calling for total war.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96065;We must defend $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests
column2: no matter the cost.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB96065;We cannot afford such a war.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96066;Assassination!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96066;The assassination of a prominent $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizen by a dissident has
column2: after a thorough investigation
column3: turned out to be at the instigation of an enemy power. This is but the latest in a string of incidents designed to destabilize $COUNTRY$. The results of the investigation have leaked to the public
column4: and massive crowds gathered in the streets of $CAPITAL$ are now calling for total war.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96070;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonies;Les Colonies $COUNTRY_ADJ$;Das $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Kolonien;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96070;According to the peace treaty
column2: our colonies and overseas territories must be surrendered. Negotiations are currently underway as to which nations they will be 'assigned' to. It appears our humiliation is not yet complete.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96070;Time to carve up our empire.;Nous n'avons aucun choix.;Wir haben keine Wahl.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96071;Transfer of the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonies;Les Colonies $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$;Das $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Kolonien;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96071;Negotiations are still underway as to which countries will obtain control over the remaining $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies and overseas territories.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA96071;We will accept control over the colony.;Nous acceptons.;Wir nehmen an.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96071;We do not wish any more colonies.;Nous refusons.;Wir lehnen ab.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96081;An isolated $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ territory has been offered to us. We should consider whether we wish to adminster it
column2: as accessing the land may be difficult according to current borders. But
column3: then again
column4: do we truly wish $FROMCOUNTRY$ to keep it?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96085;The New $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government;Le Nouveau Gouvernement $COUNTRY_ADJ$;Die Neue $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Regierung;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96085;As the armies of our former enemy depart $CAPITAL$
column2: they leave behind a newly-installed democratic government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown
column3: but many within $COUNTRY$ question whether 'freedom' imposed by a foreign power is truly that.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96085;We welcome the new regime.;Nous faisons bon accueil au nouveau régime.;Wir begrüßen das neue Regime.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96086;As the armies of our former enemy leave $CAPITAL$
column2: they leave behind a newly-installed fascist government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown
column3: but many within $COUNTRY$ seem already determined to overthrow it in the name of freedom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96087;As the armies of our former enemy leave $CAPITAL$
column2: they leave behind a newly-installed communist government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown
column3: but many within $COUNTRY$ seem already determined to overthrow it in the name of freedom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96090;End of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Monarchy;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96090;With the loss of $COUNTRY$ in the recent war
column2: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ monarchy has received much of the blame-- there have already been several assassination attempts
column3: and calls within the government for the monarchy to step down. Sentiment in the public has turned to the notion of $COUNTRY$ becoming a democracy... though some fear this will plunge the nation into even further chaos.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96130;The Price of Infamy;Le Prix de l'Infamie;Der Preis der Niedertracht;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96130;There are rumblings in the international community regarding $COUNTRY$'s warlike demeanor
column2: and some are talking about the need for a united front to contain $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aggression. There are even efforts to stir up our own citizens against us. We will have to be careful in the future
column3: lest we face not a single enemy but that of the world's great powers united against us.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96130;Just let them try it!;Laissez-les Venir!;Lassen Sie Kommen!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96131;An Ease in Tensions;Un Amoindrissement des Tensions;Eine Verminderung von Spannungen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96131;The world's great powers have taken note of $COUNTRY$'s efforts to change our aggressive ways. Some are making overtures to improve relations
column2: and their diplomats are expressing hope that $COUNTRY$ will continue to deal with other countries in a civilized manner.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96131;Thanks for the vote of confidence.;Merci pour le vote de confiance.;Dank für die Vertrauensabstimmung.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96136;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Ultimatum;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Ultimatum;Das $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Ultimatum;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96136;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached our nation with an ultimatum: dimantle $COUNTRY$ immediately
column2:
or the great powers of the world will be forced to unite against us. Their demands consist of the following:

1. The return of all unlawfully-held territories gained by conquest.
2. The release of any aspirant peoples currently within our lands.
3. The transfer of all colonies and overseas territories to the other great powers.
4. An agreement by $COUNTRY$ not to declare war on any other nation for a period of no less than ten years.

It goes without saying that these demands are extremely humiliating
column3: and the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people would be justifiably upset should we agree. If we do not
column4: however
column5: $COUNTRY$ will face a great war which even we may not be able to deal with.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96136;Never!;Nous refusons!;Wir lehnen ab!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96136;We have no choice but to accept.;Nous acceptons.;Wir nehmen an.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96141;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Joins the War;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Déclare la Guerre;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Erklärt Krieg;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96141;We have received a cable from $FROMCOUNTRY$: they have declared war upon us
column2: and will pursue the war until such a time as $COUNTRY$ is disarmed and submitted to the will of the international community.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96141;We shall see about that.;Je doute de lui.;Ich bezweifele es.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96150;$COUNTRY$ Stands Triumphant;$COUNTRY$ est Triomphante;$COUNTRY$ ist Triumphierend;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96150;We have proven that no nation can stand in $COUNTRY$'s way. We will do as we please
column2: and no amount of objection from the so-called great powers of the world will deter us from achieving our destiny. For now there is peace
column3: and if other nations seek to stop us from achieving our future goals
column4: they are welcome to try.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96150;Excellent!;Excellent!;Ausgezeichnet!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96006_NEWS_TITLE;$COUNTRY$ Near Total Collapse!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96006_NEWS_LONG;Reports from $COUNTRY$ indicate that their effort in the Great War is not going well
column2: to say the least.  Much of the country is under enemy occupation
column3: and the populace even in the free areas is suffering greatly from massive shortages. Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are urging that their leaders sue for peace—do whatever it takes to end this war
column4: and end it now. ‘This is a dark day for $COUNTRY$
column5: ’ said one official. ‘We are beyond a state of emergency. The situation is simply hopeless for us. If our allies do not come to our aid soon
column6: we are lost.’;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96006_NEWS_MEDIUM;Reports from $COUNTRY$ indicate that their effort in the Great War is not going well
column2: to say the least.  Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are urging that their leaders sue for peace—do whatever it takes to end this war
column3: and end it now.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96006_NEWS_SHORT;Reports from $COUNTRY$ indicate that their effort in the Great War is not going well. Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are urging that their leaders sue for peace.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96010_NEWS_LONG;After much deliberation following the end of the recent war
column2: delegates left $CAPITAL$ with the announcement that a treaty had been reached with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. ‘$COUNTRY$ will be dismantled
column3: ’ one official relayed. ‘Their sins shall be forgiven
column4: but in return they will give up all their colonial holdings
column5: shall release any sovereign states within their borders and return any foreign lands under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ occupation. We seek to ensure that $COUNTRY$ is in no way able to threaten world peace once more.’;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96010_NEWS_MEDIUM;After much deliberation following the end of the recent war
column2: delegates left $CAPITAL$ with the announcement that an accord had finally been reached with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government
column3: resulting in the dismantling of $COUNTRY$ and all its holdings.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96010_NEWS_SHORT;After much deliberation following the end of the recent war
column2: delegates left $CAPITAL$ with the announcement that a peace treaty had finally been reached with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96085_NEWS_TITLE;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Democracy;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96085_NEWS_LONG;With elections already underway in $COUNTRY$
column2: it has become clear that the $FROMCOUNTRY$-supported democratic government is here to stay—at least for the time being. While not everyone in $COUNTRY$ is thrilled at the idea of their freedom being imposed on them by an enemy country
column3: many are nevertheless overjoyed. ‘I do not care if $COUNTRY_ADJ$ democracy comes only because $FROMCOUNTRY$ tells us to do it
column4: ’ one citizen gushed. ‘What matters is that now I can vote.’;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96085_NEWS_MEDIUM;With elections already underway in $COUNTRY$
column2: it has become clear that the $FROMCOUNTRY$-supported democratic government is here to stay—at least for the time being. While not everyone in $COUNTRY$ is thrilled at the idea of their freedom being imposed
column3: many are nevertheless overjoyed.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96085_NEWS_SHORT;With elections already underway in $COUNTRY$, it has become clear that the $FROMCOUNTRY$-supported democratic government is here to stay—at least for the time being.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96086_NEWS_TITLE;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Fascism;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96086_NEWS_LONG;With the new
column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported government already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that fascism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stay—at least for the time being. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may have left $COUNTRY$
column4: but their presence is still felt everywhere. Efforts are already underway to suppress any resistance from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column5: and $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ flags hang in every window beside $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ones. ‘They are our allies
column6: ’ said one man. ‘Why would we not honor what they have done for us?’;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96086_NEWS_MEDIUM;With the new
column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported government already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that fascism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stay—at least for the time being. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may have left $COUNTRY$
column4: but their presence is still felt everywhere.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96086_NEWS_SHORT;With the new
column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported government already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that fascism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stay—at least for the time being.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96087_NEWS_TITLE;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Communism;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96087_NEWS_LONG;With the new
column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported politburo already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that communism  in $COUNTRY$ is here to stay—at least for the time being. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may have left $COUNTRY$
column4: but their presence is still felt everywhere. Efforts are already underway to suppress any resistance from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column5: and $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ flags hang in every window beside $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ones. ‘They are our allies
column6: ’ said one man. ‘Why would we not honor what they have done for us?’;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96087_NEWS_MEDIUM;With the new
column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported politburo already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that communism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stay—at least for the time being. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may have left $COUNTRY$
column4: but their presence is still felt everywhere.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96087_NEWS_SHORT;With the new
column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported politburo already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that communism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stay—at least for the time being.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97600;Sakoku;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97600;Meaning 'locked country'
column2: Sakoku was the foreign relations policy of Japan instituted by the Tokugawa shogunate in the 17th century
column3: with no foreigner allowed to enter the country on pain of death. While some contact with westerners was permitted in the south
column4: at the Dejima trade enclave in particular
column5: such contact was strictly regulated and kept Japan in a state of isolation from the rest of the world.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97601;Rangaku;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97601;Meaning 'Western Learning'
column2: Rangaku referred to the body of knowledge developed by Japan through its contacts with the Dutch enclave at Dejima. Despite the enforced isolation of the nation
column3: this policy of learning allowed western influences to spread-- particularly in the southern domains of Satsuma and Choshu.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97605;Kurofune;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME97606;Commodore Perry Successful;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97606;Commodore Perry has returned from his mission to Japan with a treaty in hand: we have gained numerous trade concessions
column2: but more importantly we have cracked open the shield that is Japan's policy of isolation. This is a great coup for American diplomacy and influence in the Far East.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97607;The Japanese Are Defiant!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC97607;Commodore Perry has returned from his mission to Japan with unfortunate news: they have chosen to defy his ultimatum and thumb their collective noses at our government. Should we back down now
column2: it will be a great blow to our prestige and our influence in the Far East.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97608;Japanese Surrender?;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97608;We are being overwhelmed by the superior might of western armaments. Despite the loss of face
column2: we must consider offering the hated foreigners terms of our surrender.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97609;The Japanese Have Surrendered;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97609;We have formally concluded a treaty with the Japanese which will see our influence restored
column2: and our demands for their ports to be opened to our ships to be met. Additionally
column3: an indemnity will be placed upon their government to make up for the expense of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ war effort.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97610;The Japanese Have Refused!;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97610;Despite the overwhelming odds against them
column2: the Japanese have refused our generous offer of surrender.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97615;Sonno Joi;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97615;'Revere the emperor and expel the barbarians!'\n\nThis is the slogan chanted by neo-confucian activists
column2: reacting to the Tokugawa shogunate's opening of Japan to foreigners. There have been growing reports of violence all over the country
column3: primarily against foreign visitors and statesmen but also against the shogunate itself. Each incident chips away at Tokugawa control over the daimyo and erodes relations with the western powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97616;$PROVINCENAME$ Incident;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97616;There has been an incident in $PROVINCENAME$ where samurai
column2: acting under the political slogan of 'Sonno Joi'
column3: have committed violence against foreigners conducting business in $STATENAME$. The incident has affected the Tokugawa shogunate's relations with foreign powers
column4: as well as incited locals into riot.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97617;Order to Expel the Barbarians;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97617;In an unprecedented move
column2: the Imperial Court has issued an edict to expel the foreign barbarians present in Japan. This runs in contravention to the traditional role of the Emperor as a figurehead
column3: is a challenge to the shogunate's power
column4: and may serve to further incite rebellion.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97618;In an unprecedented move
column2: the Imperial Court has issued an edict to expel the foreign barbarians present in Japan. This runs in contravention to the traditional role of the Emperor as a figurehead
column3: and is a challenge to the shogunate's power. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan must decide whether it supports the Emperor's edict or quietly opposes it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97620;The Death of Iesada;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97620;Tokugawa Iesada
column2: the 13th shogun of Japan
column3: has died childless. This has begun a struggle within the bakufu to select a replacement. The Southern Tozama Daimyo wish to see Tokugawa Yoshinobu become shogun
column4: while the fudai daimyo and shogunate officials are more in favor of Tokugawa Iemochi-- even though he is still but a child. It seems certain that
column5: no matter which candidate is victorious
column6: the disaffected daimyo will see this as a loss of power and make trouble.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97621;Tokugawa Yoshinobu is Shogun;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC97621;The shogunate has taken a step in the right direction and appointed Tokugawa Yoshinobu as the new leader of the bakufu following the death of Iesada. This was always the preferred choice of the tozama daimyo
column2: and perhaps it is a sign that the bakufu is not only willing to do what it must to keep Japan strong but also a sign that the tozama will be permitted more influence within the shogunate.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97622;Even though the fudai daimyo
column2: the relatives and close allies of the Tokugawa clan
column3: supported the appointment of young Iemochi as the new shogun following Iesada's death
column4: instead the leader of the bakufu will be Yoshinobu... a candidate favored by the outsider tozama daimyo. The fudai are growing increasingly alarmed at the insidious influence of the tozama
column5: and there is a stirring sentiment that perhaps the time has come for a grander change.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97623;Tokugawa Iemochi is Shogun;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97623;Pandering once again to the fudai daimyo
column2: all relatives and close allies within the bakufu
column3: the child Iemochi has been appointed shogun-- instead of the more sensible candidate chosen by the tozama. It is becoming increasingly clear that a larger change is necessary. Perhaps the time has come for the Emperor to rule Japan
column4: a single leader to bring the nation into this new era?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97624;The shogunate has taken a step in the right direction and appointed Tokugawa Iemochi as the new leader of the bakufu following the death of Iesada. This was always the preferred choice of the fudai daimyo
column2: and perhaps it is a sign that the bakufu is not only willing to do what it must to keep Japan strong but also a sign that the outsider tozama will have their influence in the bakufu kept to a minimum.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97625;Sakuradamon Incident;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97625;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point. Many are urging that a policy of Kobu Gattai-- a union of the bakufu and the imperial court-- may be required.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97626;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point
column3: and thus the bakufu has begun a compromise policy of Kobu Gattai-- a union of the bakufu and the imperial court. Some are seeing this as a sign of further weakness.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97627;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point
column3: yet the shogunate refuses to compromise with the imperial court. Many are certain this will only speed up the coming conflict.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97630;The Death of Emperor Komei;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97630;There are some who believe that Emperor Komei was assassinated-- delivered a handkerchief laced with smallpox
column2: perhaps by radicals who fear the possibility of compromise between the bakufu and the imperial court. No matter the truth
column3: the death of the Emperor has placed the young Emperor Meiji upon the imperial throne and eliminated any chance of compromise.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97635;Opposition to the Bakufu;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97635;There is a growing restlessness among the daimyo
column2: with some whispering that the Tokugawa shogunate has grown weak and is unable to deal with the encroachment of foreign powers. Officials within the bakufu are urging that we seek allies among either the outsider tozama or the traditional fudai
column3: to strengthen the shogunate's position. Approaching one means angering the other
column4: of course
column5: but it appears we have little choice.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97636;There is a growing restlessness among the daimyo
column2: with some whispering that the Tokugawa shogunate has grown weak and is unable to deal with the encroachment of foreign powers. We have received word that the shogunate has consulted with the outsider tozama
column3: perhaps seeking new allies. If so
column4: this compounds injury with insult.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97637;There is a growing restlessness among the daimyo
column2: with some whispering that the Tokugawa shogunate has grown weak and is unable to deal with the encroachment of foreign powers. We have received word that the shogunate has consulted with the fudai daimyo
column3: perhaps seeking new allies. This is hardly unexpected
column4: though the tozama agree this makes it clear that the shogunate is not the future of Japan.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97640;The Meiji Rebellion;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC97640;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over all of Japan. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ must make a decision: do we throw in our support with the imperial court
column2: or do we uphold our duty and support the shogun?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97641;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have seized control of the palace at Kyoto and declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over Japan. Word has it they have recruited fellow daimyo to stand with them in this traitorous war. We must issue a call to our allies and move at once!\n\n§RNOTE: To win this war
column2: you must occupy Kyoto and the rebellion leader's capital. You must not allow Edo to become occupied
column3: and you cannot White Peace. If you White Peace

column1: EVTDESC97642;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over all of Japan. We have little choice
column2: as they have forced our hand. Either we rise up against the Shogun now
column3: or the Shogun will assume we are behind the rebellion even if we are not. The time has come to fight!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97645;We Are Defeated;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97645;The Edo palace has been occupied
column2: and our loyal daimyo are on the retreat. Our advisors tell us that our only option is to lay down our arms and allow the Emperor his victory. There is a place for the Tokugawa within the new order.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97646;The Meiji Restoration;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97646;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan forces have marched triumphantly into Edo
column2: and the Tokugawa shogunate has agreed to a permanent peace. For the first time since before the Sengoku
column3: the Imperial Court now rules Japan once again. Victory is ours!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97647;Emperor Meiji has been restored to rule over Japan. An imperial messenger has arrived at the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ palace in $CAPITAL$ to demand our willing allegiance to the Emperor.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME97648;A New Capital in the East?;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97648;While Kyoto has long been the capital of Japan
column2: and home to the Imperial Court
column3: the city of Edo has become the de facto capital-- for centuries it has been the center of shogunate power
column4: as well as a cultural and administrative center. The Emperor will need to decide whether the court should move to Edo and create a new capital... or remain in Kyoto and revitalize it instead.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97650;We Are Defeated;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97650;The Imperial palace at Kyoto has been occupied
column2: and our daimyo allies are on the retreat. Our advisors tell us that our only option is to lay down our arms and allow the Shogun his victory. If we are fortunate
column3: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan will not be wiped out by this unfortunate turn of events.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97651;Tokugawa Victory;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97651;Tokugawa clan forces have marched triumphantly into Kyoto
column2: and the traitor daimyos have agreed to a permanent peace. The Bakumatsu has ended with the shogunate in control once again-- victory is ours!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97652;The Tokugawa shogunate has once again asserted control over Japan. A bakufu messenger has arrived at the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ palace in $CAPITAL$ to demand our submission to direct rule from Edo.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97605;More 'black ships' have appeared off our shores
column2: these ones commanded by an American named Commodore Matthew Perry. The ill-tempered westerner is demanding an end to the Japanese policy of Sokoku-- specifically trading rights in several ports
column3: extraterritoriality for American sailors and protection for their shipwrecks. At first he demanded to negotiate with the Emperor
column4: but that is impossible. Thus it falls to the Shogun to either agree to his demands
column5: risking the appearance of weakness
column6: or refuse and bring the wrath of the Americans upon us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97660;The Taisho Era;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97660;With the ascension of Emperor Taisho
column2: whose poor health has prompted a shift in political power from Japan's old guard to the Imperial Diet
column3: democratic parties are beginning to see their influence spread throughout the country. Though democratic tradition is not deeply rooted
column4: the idea of enfranchisement as a right of the individual Japanese citizen has become far more broadly accepted. Students
column5: university professors and journalists inspired by Western schools of thought have organized public demonstrations to demand new reforms.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97665;The Satsuma Rebellion;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC97665;A growing dissatisfaction among the former samurai with the abolition of the han system and the resulting reduction in their personal prestige has crystallized in a rebellion. Led by one of the most prestigious samurai leaders of the former Satsuma Domain
column2: Saigo Takamori
column3: the rebellion has attracted a large number of followers and will be a severe challenge for the Japanese government to deal with.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97670;The Northern Islands;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97670;The islands of Sakhalin and the Kurils are a natural extension of our holdings on Hokkaido
column2: and we must seek to claim these places before the Russians do so first.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97673;The Path of Progress;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97673;$COUNTRY$ has followed a militaristic path until now
column2: determined to set ourselves against our neighbours in the interest of security-- while risking that security with dangerous wars. The new $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has determined that this must change. We must follow a path of progress
column3: and instead devote outselves to technology and westernization if we are to remain free and whole.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97674;The Line of Advantage;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97674;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has followed a policy of progress and westernization until now
column2: hoping that advancing $COUNTRY$ to match the Western powers would keep us safe. We now see this is in error
column3: and that only by an aggressive expansion of our borders can we hope to maintain the security of $COUNTRY$ proper.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97675;China in Chaos;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97675;The Chinese have fallen into warring factions
column2: all but crumbling their power and leaving us an advantage we would be fools not to exploit. The Line of Advantage policy dictates that we should strike
column3: and strike soon.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97676;War With $FROMCOUNTRY$!;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97676;Believing $COUNTRY$ to be weak
column2: the hated Japanese have decided to strike at us and take control of our government. They shall find us a difficult target!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97677;The Korean Question;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97677;Our nation's policy of the Line of Advantage dictates that we must expand our borders if we are to maintain security. Naturally
column2: our most vulnerable point lies in neighbouring Korea. They must either be brought under our direct control or made into a vassal if $COUNTRY$ is to be kept safe. Already $COUNTRY_ADJ$ generals are clamoring for war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97678;The Formosa Question;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC97678;The recent murder of Japanese sailors off the coast of Formosa has given rise to a question within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government: should we use this excuse to step in and wrest control of the southern island? The Line of Advantage is clear
column2: dictating that the land would be invaluable to our goals. But are we willing to risk such a war?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97679;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Demand;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97679;After the recent murders of a number of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ sailors off the coast of Formosa
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has delivered a demand: turn over the island
column3: for the sake of their security
column4: or it shall be war between $FROMCOUNTRY$ and $COUNTRY$. We know this is just an excuse for their militarist expansion... but can we stand up against their might?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME150000;Calls for Decolonisation;;;;;;x
EVTDESC150000;Unrest in our colonies has risen to unprecedented levels! With the eyes of the world now upon us
column2: every action we take to suppress our colonial subjects will trigger international repercussions. Unless we want to become the laughingstock of the civilised world it would seem like we will either have to make compromises or grant our colonies independence.;;;;;;x
