ev_20000040;First Female Actress;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000040;Marie Vernier
column2: or Venier was a French actress. She is commonly thought to be the first actress to be known by name. Vernier was the leading lady and co-director of Valleran-Lecomte's theatre company
column3: which performed in Hotel de Bourgogne in Paris and toured the country and the Spanish Netherlands.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000041;The Blue Mosque is Complete!;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000041;Sultan Ahmet the First decided to build a big mosque in Istanbul to calm God. It would be the first imperial mosque for more than forty years. While his predecessors had paid for their mosques with their spoil of war
column2: Ahmet the First had to remove the funds of the Treasury
column3: because he had not gained remarkable victories. It caused the anger of oul?mas
column4: the Muslim jurists. The mosque must be built on the site of the palace of the Byzantine emperors
column5: in front of the basilica Ayasofya (at that time
column6: the mosque the most worshipped in Istanbul) and the racecourse
column7: a site of a big symbolic meaning. Big parts of the south shore of the mosque rest on the foundations
column8: the vaults of the old Grand Palace.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000042;Inherit Prussia!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000042;As in 1618
column2: Albert Frederick had no surviving male heirs
column3: the co-enfeoffment of 1569
column4: confirmed by the Treaty of Warsaw in 1611
column5: allowed his son-in-law
column6: Elector John Sigismund of the Hohenzollern branch in Brandenburg
column7: to become the duke's legal successor
column8: thereafter ruling Brandenburg and Ducal Prussia in personal union. Brandenburg
column9: being a fief of the Holy Roman Empire
column10: and Ducal Prussia
column11: being a Polish fief
column12: made a cross-border real union legally impossible. De facto Brandenburg and Ducal Prussia were more and more ruled as one
column13: and colloquially referred to as Brandenburg-Prussia.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000043;First Merry-Go-Round!;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000043;"The modern carousel emerged from early jousting traditions in Europe and the Middle East. Knights would gallop in a circle while tossing balls from one to another; an activity that required great skill and horsemanship. This game was introduced to Europe at the time of the Crusades from earlier Byzantine and Arab traditions. The word carousel originated from the Italian garosello and Spanish carosella (""little battle""
column2: used by crusaders to describe a combat preparation exercise and game played by Turkish and Arabian horsemen in the 12th century). This early device was essentially a cavalry training mechanism; it prepared and strengthened the riders for actual combat as they wielded their swords at the mock enemies.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000044;River Thames Froze!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000044;This year's severe winter led to something that did not happen for many decades
column2: the river Thames froze. Our people were cautious at first
column3: but now they celebrate upon the frozen water of our main river.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000045;Osaka Castle Restored;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000045;During the summer of 1615
column2: Hideyori began to dig the outer moat once more. Tokugawa
column3: in outrage
column4: sent his armies to Osaka Castle again
column5: and routed the Toyotomi men inside the outer walls on June 4. Osaka Castle fell to Tokugawa
column6: and the Toyotomi clan perished. In 1620
column7: the new heir to the shogunate
column8: Tokugawa Hidetada
column9: began to reconstruct and re-arm Osaka Castle. He built a new elevated main tower
column10: five stories on the outside and eight stories on the inside
column11: and assigned the task of constructing new walls to individual samurai clans. The walls built in the 1620s still stand today
column12: and are made out of interlocked granite boulders without mortar. Many of the stones were brought from rock quarries near the Seto Inland Sea
column13: and bear inscribed crests of the various families who contributed them.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000046;Rudbeckianska Gymnasiet Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000046;The first secondary school of Sweden was founded this year
column2: showing the fact the Sweden is on its way becoming a country of higher level education.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000047;Recapture of Baghdad;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000047;We lost the city of Baghdad to the Ottomans
column2: yet it is de jure our land and we will do anything to retake it. To war!;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000048;New Netherlands Colonized!;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000048;New Netherland was a 17th-century colonial province of the Seven United Netherlands that was located on the East Coast of North America. The claimed territories extended from the Delmarva Peninsula to extreme southwestern Cape Cod
column2: while the more limited settled areas are now part of the Mid-Atlantic States of New York
column3: New Jersey
column4: Delaware
column5: and Connecticut
column6: with small outposts in Pennsylvania and Rhode Island. The provincial capital of New Amsterdam was located at the southern tip of the island of Manhattan on New York Harbor.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000049;First Mail Service Begins Duty;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000049;The first public postal system began duty this year
column2: allowing people to connect to the rest of the advanced Europe through letters.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000050;Naples Earthquake;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000050;This morning an earthquake shook the city of Naples killing a great part of the population. We can only hope that this does not lead to any volcanic activity.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000051;Wurzburg Witch Trials;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000051;The Wurzburg witch trial
column2: which took place in Germany in 1626?1631
column3: is one of the biggest mass-trials and mass-executions in the 17th century.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000052;Aurochs Go Extinct;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000052;The aurochs
column2: the ancestor of domestic cattle
column3: is an extinct type of large wild cattle that inhabited Europe
column4: Asia and North Africa. The species survived in Europe until the last recorded aurochs died in the Jaktor?w Forest.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000053;Barbados Settled;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000053;The Caribbean island of Barbados
column2: a strategically important island has been settled for the first time after its colonization
column3: gaining us more land in the New World.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000054;Barbados Settled;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000054;The Caribbean island of Barbados
column2: a strategically important island has been settled for the first time after its colonization
column3: gaining us more land in the New World.;;;;;;x;;

column1: desc_ev_20000055;Vasa is a Swedish warship built 1626-1628. The ship foundered and sank after sailing about 1
column2: 300 m into her maiden voyage on 10 August 1628. She fell into obscurity after most of her valuable bronze cannons were salvaged in the 17th century.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000056;Popped Corn?;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000056;"The English settlers colonizing the Americas met a Native American tribe who introduced them with a food strange to them
column2: what in our language would be called ""popped corn""
column3: it is nothing more
column4: but corn
column5: the new vegetable came from the New World put into fire. It may become popular once.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000057;Popped Corn?;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000057;"The English settlers colonizing the Americas met a Native American tribe who introduced them with a food strange to them
column2: what in our language would be called ""popped corn""
column3: it is nothing more
column4: but corn
column5: the new vegetable came from the New World put into fire. It may become popular once.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000058;Deccan Famine!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000058;With the bad crops of the recent years and the drought of this year our people are suffering
column2: trying to survive from day to day with what little food they have. News of cannibalism has reached the palace
column3: and even the leading nobles of our country fear what's coming next.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000059;La Gazette Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000059;La Gazette
column2: originally Gazette de France
column3: was the first weekly magazine published in France. It was founded by Th?ophraste Renaudot and issued its first number on May 30
column4: 1631. It progressively became the mouthpiece of one royalist faction
column5: the Legitimists.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000060;Taj Mahal Construction Started;;;;;;x;;

column2: Shah Jahan
column3: emperor during the Mughal empire's period of greatest prosperity
column4: was grief-stricken when his third wife
column5: Mumtaz Mahal
column6: a Persian princess
column7: died during the birth of their 14th child
column8: Gauhara Begum. Construction of the Taj Mahal began in 1632. The court chronicles of Shah Jahan's grief illustrate the love story traditionally held as an inspiration for Taj Mahal.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000061;University of Tartu Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000061;"The University of Tartu is a classical university in the city of Tartu
column2: Estonia. University of Tartu is the national university of Estonia; it is the biggest and highest-ranked university in Estonia. The University of Tartu is a member of the Coimbra Group and the Utrecht Network
column3: and was established by King Gustavus Adolphus of Sweden in 1632
column4: thus being one of the oldest universities in Northern Europe.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000062;Sakoku Started;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000062;Sakoku was the foreign relations policy of Japan under which no foreigner could enter nor could any Japanese leave the country on penalty of death. The policy was enacted by the Tokugawa shogunate under Tokugawa Iemitsu through a number of edicts and policies from 1633?39.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000063;Galilei Convicted of Heresy;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000063;"Galilei met with opposition from astronomers
column2: who doubted heliocentrism due to the absence of an observed stellar parallax. The matter was investigated by the Roman Inquisition in 1615
column3: which concluded that heliocentrism was false and contrary to scripture
column4: placing works advocating the Copernican system on the index of banned books and forbidding Galileo from advocating heliocentrism. Galileo later defended his views in Dialogue Concerning the Two Chief World Systems
column5: which appeared to attack Pope Urban VIII
column6: thus alienating not only the Pope but also the Jesuits
column7: who had both supported Galileo up until this point. He was tried by the Holy Office
column8: then found ""vehemently suspect of heresy""
column9: was forced to recant
column10: and spent the rest of his life under house arrest.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000064;St Culomb's Cathedral Finished;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000064;St Columb's is the first cathedral to be built by the Anglican church after the Reformation in the British Isles and the first non-roman catholic cathedral to be built in Europe.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000065;Trois Riviere Colonized;;;;;;x;;

column2: while surveying the Saint-Lawrence River
column3: Samuel de Champlain recommended establishing a permanent settlement in the area
column4: which was finally done on July 4
column6: by the Sieur of Laviolette.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000066;Academie Francaise Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000066;L'Academie francaise
column2: also called the French Academy
column3: is the pre-eminent French learned body on matters pertaining to the French language. The Acad?mie was officially established in 1635 by Cardinal Richelieu
column4: the chief minister to King Louis XIII.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000067;Paulaner Brewery Founded;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000067;The name of the Paulaner brewery refers to the order of friars that resided in Neuhauser Stra?e in Munich who were part of the order of Saint Francis of Paola. The friars had brewed beer for their own use since 1634. The beer that was permitted to be sold on holidays was a Bock style which gained local fame. Paulaner is one of the six breweries who provide oktoberfestbier for Oktoberfest
column2: the German beer festival dating from 1810.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000068;Guadeloupe and Martinique Colonized;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000068;Two new islands have been colonized and settled for the glory of our nation.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000069;Pearl Mosque Complete;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000069;Moti Masjid
column2: is a 17th-century religious building located inside the Lahore Fort. It is a small
column3: white marble structure built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan
column4: and is among his prominent extensions (such as Sheesh Mahal and Naulakha pavilion) to the Lahore Fort Complex.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000070;University of Trnava Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000070;The original Jesuit university was founded in 1635 by the Archbishop of Esztergom
column2: P?ter P?zm?ny. It had a faculty of arts and a faculty of theology at first. It lasted 142 years in Trnava before being moved.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000071;Atlas Novus Published;;;;;;x;;

column2: Willem Blaeu bought the copperplates of several dozens of maps from Jodocus Hondius II's widow. Afterwards
column3: he published an Atlantis Appendix to Mercator's atlas in 1630
column4: containing 60 maps
column5: but no text. The next year a new edition was published
column6: with 98 maps and descriptive text in Latin. Willem and his son Joan Blaeu made a public announcement in an Amsterdam newspaper that they would publish their own full atlas in 1634. Their first atlas was completed in 1635 and appeared in four different versions: Novus Atlas
column7: Atlas Novus
column8: Toonneel des Aerdrycks and finally Theatre du Monde ou Nouvel Atlas.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000072;University of Oxford Chartered;;;;;;x;;

column2: Chancellor William Laud
column3: Archbishop of Canterbury
column4: codified the university's statutes. These
column5: to a large extent
column6: remained its governing regulations until the mid-19th century. Laud was also responsible for the granting of a charter securing privileges for the University Press
column7: and he made significant contributions to the Bodleian Library
column8: the main library of the university.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000073;Tiangong Kaiwu Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000073;The Tiangong Kaiwu
column2: or The Exploitation of the Works of Nature was a Chinese encyclopedia compiled by Song Yingxing. It was published in May 1637 with funding provided by Song's patron Tu Shaokui. The Tiangong Kaiwu is an encyclopedia covering a wide range of technical issues
column3: including the use of various gunpowder weapons. Copies of the book were very scarce in China during the Qing dynasty
column4: but original copies of the book were preserved in Japan.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000074;Teatro San Cassiano Complete;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000074;The Teatro San Cassiano or Teatro di San Cassiano in Venice was the first public opera house when it opened in 1637. The theatre takes its name from the neighbourhood where it was located
column2: the parish of San Cassiano near the Rialto. It was a stone building owned by the Venetian Tron family. It was considered 'public' as it was directed by an impresario
column3: or general manager
column4: for the paying public rather than for nobles exclusively.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000075;Red Fort Begins Construction;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000075;Shah Jahan commissioned construction of the Red Fort in 1638
column2: when he decided to shift his capital from Agra to Delhi. Its design is credited to architect Ustad Ahmad Lahauri. The fort lies along the Yamuna River
column3: which fed the moats surrounding most of the walls. Construction began in the sacred month of Muharram

column1: ev_20000076;Iberian Union Ends!;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000076;As we tried to strengthen our control over Portugal it only led to angering the Portuguese nobility. This situation culminated in a revolution by the nobility and high bourgeoisie on December 1
column3: 60 years after the crowning of Philip I. The rebels killed Secretary of State Miguel de Vasconcelos and imprisoned the king's cousin
column4: the Duchess of Mantua
column5: who had governed Portugal in his name. The support of the people became apparent almost immediately and soon John
column6: 8th Duke of Braganza
column7: was acclaimed King of Portugal throughout the country as John IV. By December 2
column9: John had already sent a letter to the Municipal Chamber of ?vora as sovereign of the country.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000077;Braganza Dynasty Started;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000077;The House of Braganza became the reigning house of the Kingdom of Portugal and the Algarves in 1640
column2: when Jo?o II
column3: Duke of Braganza
column4: was acclaimed King Joao IV by the Portuguese nobility and subsequently waged the Portuguese Restoration War. The House of Braganza was only recognized as the legitimate ruling house of Portugal by the House of Habsburg during the reign of King Afonso VI
column5: though effective and official control of the kingdom was seized and established in the 1640s.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000078;First Coffee House Opened;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000078;Our commerce with the Ottoman Empire yielded with an interesting new good
column2: the coffee. It is nothing more but some brown seed
column3: that
column4: if roasted and boiled creates a liquid that energizes people. The very first house that actually serves this drink has been opened in our city.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000079;Massive Epidemic Breaks Out!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000079;The plague has returned to our country
column2: wiping out major cities and villages all around. Non of the traditional curing techniques worked
column3: all we can do is pray and hide. May the Sun rise again over China.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000080;Rembrandt's Night Watch Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000080;Militia Company of District II under the Command of Captain Frans Banninck Cocq
column2: also known as The Shooting Company of Frans Banning Cocq and Willem van Ruytenburch
column3: but commonly referred to as The Night Watch
column4: is a 1642 painting by Rembrandt van Rijn. The painting may be more properly titled by its long since forgotten name The Company of captain Frans Banning Cocq and lieutenant Willem van Ruytenburch preparing to march out. In the 18th century the painting became known as the Night Watch.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000081;Start of the Qing Dynasty;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000081;"The dynasty was founded by the Jurchen Aisin Gioro clan in Northeastern China
column2: historically known as Manchuria. In the late sixteenth century
column3: Nurhachi
column4: originally a Ming vassal
column5: began organizing Jurchen clans into ""Banners
column6: military-social units and forming a Manchu people. By 1636
column7: his son Hong Taiji began driving Ming forces out of southern Manchuria and declared a new dynasty
column8: the Qing.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000082;Toricelli Discovers the Barometer;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000082;"Torricelli's chief invention was the mercury barometer. ""This instrument is named from two Greek words
column2: signifying two measures of weight
column3: since by it a column of air is weighed against a column of mercury."" The barometer arose from the need to solve a practical problem. Pump makers of the Grand Duke of Tuscany attempted to raise water to a height of 12 meters or more
column4: but found that 10 meters was the limit with a suction pump (as recounted in Galileo's Dialogue). Torricelli employed mercury
column5: fourteen times more dense than water. In 1643 he created a tube approximately one meter long
column6: sealed at the top
column7: filled it with mercury
column8: and set it vertically into a basin of mercury. The column of mercury fell to about 76 cm
column9: leaving a Torricellian vacuum above. As we now know
column10: the column's height fluctuated with changing atmospheric pressure; this was the first barometer. The discovery of the principle of the barometer has perpetuated his fame (""Torricellian tube""
column11: ""Torricellian vacuum"").";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000083;Sigismund's Column Erected;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000083;Erected between 1643 and 1644
column2: the column was constructed on the orders of Sigismund's son and successor
column3: King W?adys?aw IV Vasa. It was designed by the Italian-born architect Constantino Tencalla and the sculptor Clemente Molli
column4: and cast by Daniel Tym. The Sigismund's Column was modelled on the Italian columns in front of Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore
column5: and the Column of Phocas in Rome.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000084;Red Fort Complete;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000084;The Red Fort was built as the fortified palace of Shahjahanabad
column2: capital of the fifth Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan
column3: in 1648. Named for its massive enclosing walls of red sandstone
column4: it is adjacent to the older Salimgarh Fort
column5: built by Islam Shah Suri in 1546. The imperial apartments consist of a row of pavilions
column6: connected by a water channel known as the Stream of Paradise. The Red Fort is considered to represent the zenith of Mughal creativity under Shah Jahan.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000085;First Modern Palio Race;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000085;"The earliest known antecedents of the race are medieval. The town's central piazza was the site of public games
column2: largely combative: pugna
column3: a sort of many-sided boxing match or brawl; jousting; and in the 16th century
column4: bullfights. Public races organized by the contrade were popular from the 14th century on; called palii alla lunga
column5: they were run across the whole city. When the Grand Duke of Tuscany outlawed bullfighting in 1590
column6: the contrade took to organizing races in the Piazza del Campo. The first such races were on buffalo-back and called bufalate; asinate
column7: races on donkey-back
column8: later took their place
column9: while horse racing continued elsewhere. The first modern Palio (called palio alla tonda to distinguish it from the earlier palii alla lunga) took place this year.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000086;Amsterdam Flooded!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000086;The recent
column2: and still ongoing huge storm has raised the water level of the sea so much that the city of Amsterdam got flooded. May God have mercy on our souls!;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000087;Taj Mahal Complete!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000087;"The Taj Mahal
column2: the ""crown of palaces"" has been finished. It was built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his third wife
column3: Mumtaz Mahal. The Taj Mahal is widely recognized as ""the jewel of Muslim art in India and one of the universally admired masterpieces of the world's heritage"".";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000088;Free Our Brethen!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000088;The people of Ukrain have lived long enough under the oppression of the Polish. We wish to free them
column2: so they can rejoin us
column3: their brothers and sisters. For Mother Russia
column4: forward!;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000089;Titan Discovered!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000089;The moon Titan
column2: the largest moon of Saturn has been discovered by the Dutch astronomer Christiaan Huygens. Huygens was inspired by Galileo's discovery of Jupiter's four largest moons in 1610 and his improvements in telescope technology.[19] Christiaan
column3: with the help of his brother Constantijn Huygens
column4: Jr.
column5: began building telescopes around 1650. Christiaan Huygens discovered this first observed moon orbiting Saturn with the first telescope they built.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000090;Stockholms Banco Issues Banknotes;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000090;Johan Palmstruch had made two failed proposals for the creation of a banking institution in the 1650s before his third proposal
column2: with the addition of a promise to pay half of the bank's profits to the crown
column3: was accepted. King Charles X Gustav thus signed two charters on November 30
column4: 1656 to create an exchange bank and a loans bank. The bank itself was no great innovation as it was simply an imitation of the large and successful banks in Amsterdam and Hamburg that had been founded earlier in the 17th century
column5: but it was hoped that the bank would help to stabilise Sweden's currency. Sweden at that time did not have a single currency
column6: rather there was one daler minted in copper (kopparmynt) and another minted in silver (silvermynt). As the metal content of a copper daler had to be worth as much as that of a silver one
column7: this meant that copper daler were large and heavy plate-sized coins. In practice
column8: however
column9: the silver daler was worth more and these were often hoarded
column10: so generally only these large kopparmynt daler were commonly available. Palmstruch's second major innovation was the introduction of paper banknotes as a solution to the bank's problems balancing deposits and loans. To cover the amounts requested by the account holders
column11: in 1661 he began to make out credit notes (Kreditivsedlar) in round denominations which were freely transferable and backed by the promise of future payment in metal. These were the first European banknotes.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000091;Fifty Shilling Coin Minted;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000091;The English fifty shilling coin
column2: worth 50/-
column3: was only ever minted once
column4: in the year 1656. It was a milled gold coin weighing 22.7 grams and with a diameter of 30 millimetres. Only eleven examples are known to survive. One extremely fine specimen was recorded to have been sold for ?15

column1: ev_20000092;Business Found in Osaka;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000092;A new bank and money changing facility has been found in the city of Osaka. This
column2: being a larger business may bring us some extra income.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000093;The Great Fire of Edo;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000093;Today morning the people of Japan woke up to most of the city of Edo
column2: our capital burning. We could barely do anything to control the fire
column3: leading to the death of tens of thousands.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000094;First Chocolate House Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000094;With the growing commerce with the New World the new plant
column2: chocolate became more and more widespread between our nobility
column3: leading to the opening of the first shop selling only chocolate in the World.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000095;Coffee Introduced;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000095;The new drink that has been spreading from Venice
column2: coffee has reached our capital
column3: becoming popular between our nobility.;;;;;;x;;

column1: desc_ev_20000096;A new luxurity
column2: cocoa has been brought to our court by Infanta Maria Theresa. Our nobility was cautious at first but they all seemed to enjoy this new
column3: bitter delicacy.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000097;De Homine Published;;;;;;x;;

column2: Thomas Hobbes published the final section of his philosophical system
column3: completing the scheme he had planned more than twenty years before. De Homine consisted for the most part of an elaborate theory of vision. The remainder of the treatise dealt cursorily with some of the topics more fully treated in the Human Nature and the Leviathan.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000098;Great Drought!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000098;Our country faces a great drought once again leading to poverty
column2: hunger and starvation. Our people are fighting for the tiniest of food supplies and we can do nothing about it
column3: sadly.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000099;First Banknotes Issued;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000099;The first short-lived attempt at issuing banknotes by a central bank was in 1661 by Stockholms Banco
column2: a predecessor of the Bank of Sweden. These replaced the copper-plates being used instead as a means of payment. This banknote issue was brought about by the peculiar circumstances of the Swedish coin supply. Cheap foreign imports of copper had forced the Crown to steadily increase the size of the copper coinage to maintain its value relative to silver. The heavy weight of the new coins encouraged merchants to deposit it in exchange for receipts. These became banknotes when the manager of the Bank decoupled the rate of note issue from the bank currency reserves.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000100;Public Transport?;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000100;A new way of transportation inside the city of Paris has been developed
column2: called the omnibus. This is a larger car
column3: with multiple seats pulled by a horse. This way multiple people can travel together
column4: who go in the same direction without the use of multiple stagecoaches.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000101;Royal Society Chartered;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000101;The Royal Society of London for Improving Natural Knowledge
column2: commonly known as the Royal Society
column3: is a learned society for science
column4: and is possibly the oldest such society still in existence. ;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000102;Academy of Fine Arts Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000102;In the classes for fine arts
column2: sculpture
column3: visual arts
column4: painting
column5: artistic concepts
column6: art education
column7: gold- and silversmithing
column8: as well as graphic design
column9: the professors and students carry out candid discussions. The master courses of Architecture and Urban Studies as well as Art and Public Space are among the most renowned in their fields.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000103;Theatre Royal Opens on Drury Lane;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000103;The Theatre Royal
column2: Drury Lane
column3: commonly known as Drury Lane
column4: is a West End theatre in Covent Garden
column5: in the London borough of Westminster. The building faces Catherine Street (earlier named Bridges or Brydges Street) and backs onto Drury Lane. The current building is the most recent in a line of four theatres which were built at the same location.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000104;Severe Frost;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000104;The winter is even more severe than what was expected previously
column2: leading to many deaths because of the extreme cold and the low level of heating.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000105;Prix de Rome;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000105;The Prix de Rome was a scholarship for arts students. It was created
column2: initially for painters and sculptors
column3: in France during the reign of Louis XIV. It was an annual bursary for promising artists having proved their talents by completing a very difficult elimination contest. The prize
column4: organised by the Acad?mie Royale de Peinture et de Sculpture (Royal Academy of Painting and Sculpture)
column5: was open to their students.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000106;Duke of York and Albany's Maritime Regiment of Foot;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000106;Duke of York and Albany's Maritime Regiment of Foot raised from the Trained Bands of London and later renamed Lord Admiral's Regiment. It is regarded as the earliest predecessor of the Royal Marines.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000107;Gazzetta di Mantova;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000107;The Gazzetta di Mantova has been published for the first time as a daily newspaper. It quickly became popular
column2: being the first local and one of the first of the world's newspapers.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000108;Journal des Scavans;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000108;The Journal des scavans
column2: established by Denis de Sallo
column3: was the earliest academic journal published in Europe. Its content included obituaries of famous men
column4: church history
column5: and legal reports.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000109;First Scientific Journal!;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000109;"The Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society (Phil. Trans.) is a scientific journal published by the Royal Society of London. It is the first journal in the world exclusively devoted to science. The use of the word ""philosophical"" in the title refers to ""natural philosophy""
column2: which was the equivalent of what would now be generically called ""science"".";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000110;Great Plague of London;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000110;The plague has returned once again
column2: killing tens of thousands of our people. The court had no choice but to be moved away in these dangerous times. The temporary capital has been chosen to be Salisbury. May God protect us from this deadly disease.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000111;University of Kiel Founded;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000111;Kiel University has been founded in the state of Kiel under the name of Academia Holsatorum Chiloniensis by Duke Christian Albert. It quickly became the largest and most prestigous university of North Germany.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000112;The Plague Ends;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000112;The great plague has finally ended
column2: taking thousands of innocent souls with itself. We don't know what brought God's wrath upon us
column3: but we have been severly punished for it. With the disease gone the court can finally return to London.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000113;Great Fire of London;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000113;The plague has just finished and yet again London faces another disaster. This morning a fire started somewhere leading to the ultimate destruction of great areas in the city. Luckily barely any citizen casulties have been noted
column2: but many has been reported missing...;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000114;French Academy of Sciences Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000114;The French Academy of Sciences is a learned society
column2: founded by Louis XIV at the suggestion of Jean-Baptiste Colbert
column3: to encourage and protect the spirit of French scientific research.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000115;Lund University Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000115;After the recent developements the needs of the people led to the charting and opening of a new university in Lund
column2: the University of Lund. This will allow us to educate the coming generations better
column3: improving our scientific output.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000116;Dubrovnik Shaken!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000116;One of the most devastating earthquake has hit our lands. Almost the whole city
column2: including many public buildings have been destroyed. These are dark times for our people.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000117;Paradise Lost Published;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000117;"Paradise Lost is an epic poem in blank verse by the poet John Milton. The poem concerns the Biblical story of the Fall of Man: the temptation of Adam and Eve by the fallen angel Satan and their expulsion from the Garden of Eden. Milton's purpose
column2: stated in Book I
column3: is to ""justify the ways of God to men"".";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000118;First French Grenadiers;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000118;A grenadier was originally a specialized soldier
column2: first established as a distinct role in the mid-to-late 17th century by our great king
column3: Louis. Their role was the throwing of grenades and sometimes assault operations. At that time grenadiers were chosen from the strongest and largest soldiers.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000119;Riksbank Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000119;After the collapse of the previous great bank of Sweden the new bank chose not issue banknotes. This bank is the first one in whole Europe that became a national bank
column2: the central bank of our glorious nation.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000120;Etna Erupts!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000120;The volcano of Etna has became active once again
column2: erupting
column3: surprising the local population as they tried to do their best to protect themselves
column4: it wasn't enough for many of them. We shall pray for their souls.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000121;Hanseatic League's Last Meeting;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000121;By the late 16th century
column2: the League had imploded and could no longer deal with its own internal struggles
column3: the social and political changes that accompanied the Protestant Reformation
column4: the rise of Dutch and English merchants
column5: and the incursion of the Ottoman Empire upon its trade routes and upon the Holy Roman Empire itself. Only nine members attended the last formal meeting in 1669
column6: ending this once great trading alliance.;;;;;;x;;

column1: desc_ev_20000122;The recent year's bad crops and droughts led to food shortage between our borders. We can do nothing but watch as the people of our nation kills one another to eat. Even our nobles have to portion their secret food stockages.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000123;Stradivari's First Violin;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000123;A citizen of Cremona
column2: called Stadivari has created a violin of remarkable quality. It's handcrafted and is valued really high. His name will leave a mark on the history of music
column3: that is for sure.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000124;Okaya&Co Ltd. Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000124;The first big trading company has been founded in the town of Okaya. Their business in our country led to a boost to governmental income.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000125;Tongrentang Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000125;Yue Xianyang
column2: a scientist and doctor serving under our dynasty has created a company solely for the developement of new medications and the research of herbs. We shall experience a boost to our population from the outcome of these researches.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000126;Acad?mie Royale d'Architecture Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000126;An academy dedicated to the art of architecture has been founded by Louis XIV
column2: under the impulsion of Jean-Baptiste Colbert. This may lead to the construction of buildings that shall remind the future generations of our glorious history.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000127;Chelsea Physic Garden Established;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000127;A new botanical garden has been founded in London
column2: also referred to as Apothecaries' Garden to study the herbs we know of
column3: and help the developement of the science of healing.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000128;Mitsui Takatoshi Granted Permission;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000128;Mitsui Takatoshi a prominent citizen of our nation has been given the right to work as a money exchanger in our country. He immediatly developed a new system of inter city loans that didn't only mean profit for him
column2: but to the state aswell.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000129;Royal Greenwich Observatory Begins Construction;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000129;The establishment of a Royal Observatory was proposed in 1674 by Sir Jonas Moore who
column2: in his role as Surveyor General at the Ordnance Office
column3: persuaded King Charles II to the creation of the observatory
column4: with John Flamsteed being installed as its director. The Ordnance Office was given responsibility for building the Observatory
column5: with Moore providing the key instruments and equipment for the observatory at his own personal cost. Flamsteed House
column6: the original part of the Observatory
column7: was designed by Sir Christopher Wren
column8: probably with the assistance of Robert Hooke
column9: and was the first purpose-built scientific research facility in Britain.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000130;Flavoured Ice?;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000130;"A new delicacy has been showed to the Parisian nobility
column2: called ""ice cream"". This is a strange food made of freezing flavored liquid
column3: then crushing it until it's soft. It really is strange
column4: but the nobles did appreciate it
column5: after being cautious with it at first.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000131;Fleet Ran Aground!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000131;The fleet of Jean d'Estrees
column2: a marshal of our nation has ran his fleet onto a reef
column3: destroying it completely while he was heading to the port of Curacao.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000132;First Woman With Doctorate;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000132;Elena Lucrezia Cornaro Piscopia
column2: a citizen of Mantua has succesfully finished her studies in the university of Mantua. She is the first woman in the history to ever achieve this.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000133;Jizya Reintroduced;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000133;The Islamic tax of Jizya has been reintroduced into the law of our Empire following the recent years' wars and constructions. The population may not be happy
column2: but this is what we must do in order to achieve our goals of expansion and developement.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000134;Great Comet Sighted;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000134;Our nation is the first to sight the great comet that appeared on the sky today. In the past people may have thought that comets bring bad luck
column2: but luckily we live in enlightened times.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000135;The Palatinate Acquired;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000135;Our relations and diplomatic transactions with the Duchy of The Palatinate led to bright results. With the death of the last of their dynasty we inherited all of their lands. We will surely find a good opportunity to use them strategically against our rivals.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000136;Canal du Midi Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000136;The Canal du Midi
column2: a 241 kilometers long canal has been finally opened in Southern France
column3: connecting the Garonne River to the Mediterranean and this way with the older Canal de Garonne it connects the Mediterrean with the Atlantic Ocean.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000137;Basilica of Santa Maria della Saluta Finished;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000137;A new minor basilica has been built in Venice
column2: called Santa Maria della Salute. The Salute is a vast
column3: octagonal building with two domes and a pair of picturesque bell-towers at the back. Built on a platform made of 1
column5: 000 wooden piles
column6: it is constructed of Istrian stone and marmorino (brick covered with marble dust). At the apex of the pediment stands a statue of the Virgin Mary who presides over the church which was erected in her honour. The fa?ade is decorated with figures of Saint George
column7: Saint Theodore
column8: the Evangelists
column9: the Prophets
column10: Judith with the head of Holofernes.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000138;Court Moved to Versailles;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000138;Holy king Louis XIV moved his royal court to the palace of Versailles
column2: founding the most well-known symbol of French Baroque and of the Absolute Monarchy.;;;;;;x;;

column1: desc_ev_20000139;A new tzar has been crowned earlier this day
column2: as he began his rulership as Peter
column3: the first. May he reign for a long time and bring Russia to glory!;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000140;Moscow Riots;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000140;The serfs and soldiers have risen up in the city of Moscow against their officers and the nobles
column2: butchering them as they could not hide
column3: because of the attack's suddenness. May God save their souls.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000141;Take Vienna!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000141;Our armies are larger than ever. Our people desire more lands
column2: loot and glory. There is no time better than now to go and take what is rightfully ours and fulfill our goal of conquering the Habsburgs
column3: our sworn enemies. In the name of Allah
column4: forward!;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000142;Wild Boars Disappear;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000142;Hunting has always been a part of our culture
column2: yet the growing nobility has gone way too far with their hobby. The wild boars
column3: once a sigil of the ancient tribes has been hunted to extinction on the Isle of Britain.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000143;Chief Minister Assassinated!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000143;Our chief minister
column2: Hotta Masatoshi has been executed leaving the shogun without any proper advisors. This led to reforms that were only bad for our nation and decisions that have all been regretted by our apparently weak shogun.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000144;The Greatest Poet?;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000144;A poet of our nation
column2: Saikaku composed 23500 verses under twenty four hours. This is an achievement that the Western Barbarians shall never reach. It's a great day to be Japanese!;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000145;World's First Street Lighting;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000145;The recent cold and dark winters
column2: and the criminal acts done under the cover of these nights led to a new project in the city of London. The creation of a lantern system on the streets that were centrally operated at dark winter nights to prevent misdeeds.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000146;Pantheon Destroyed!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000146;Our recent activities against the Ottoman Empire led to a sad result. One of our ships was given information about a possible gunpowder storage
column2: and fired at it without order. Apparently this storage was the Acropolis
column3: as the Ottomans believed noone would destroy such a relic of ancient times. This will surely lower the overall view of our nation.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000147;Bulgaria Rises Up!;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000147;Our European province of Bulgaria got enough of our oppresive rulership and rose up against it. We can do nothing but use our forces to recapture the lands that are rightfully ours.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000148;The Great Siberian Road;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000148;The longest road of history has begun construction joining the far east with our central provinces. This will surely be a long project
column2: but it will lead to the developement of new cities along the way
column3: and it will surely make trade easier.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000149;Famine in Mexico City!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000149;The weak crops and droughts led to the shortage of food in Mexico City
column2: one of our highest populated cities in the New World. The unrest of the population is growing slowly
column3: but surely.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000150;Academia Operosorum Labacensium Founded;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000150;The Academia Operosorum Labacensium has been founded in the city of Ljubljana as an association of 23 scholars. We shall see an increase in scientific developement in the following years.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000151;An European Federation?;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000151;William Penn
column2: a big real estate entrepreneur and philisopher has created an idea of the United European Nation
column3: to stop the inner conflicts of Europe and create a location of peaceful developement in the world. His first proposal was to create an European Parliament
column4: of course it being completely unrealistic
column5: was denied.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000152;Musical Traditions;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000152;A new book has been assembled for Sultan II by the prince of Moldavia
column2: Dimitrie Cantemir
column3: who is also a historian
column4: linguist and ethnographer
column5: called The Book of the Science of Music. It covers the musical and other traditions of our Empire far and wide.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000153;Bank of England Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000153;The establishment of the bank was devised by Charles Montagu
column2: 1st Earl of Halifax
column4: to the plan which had been proposed by William Paterson three years before
column5: but not acted upon. The Royal Charter was granted on 27 July through the passage of the Tonnage Act 1694.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000154;Slave Ship Sinks;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000154;The slave ship called Hannibal has sinked on its voyage to the New World. Luckily it was still close to the shore
column2: but about half of the slaves still drowned or got taken away by the waves.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000155;Press Censorship Lifted;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000155;The law regulating the press has not been renewed leading to a somewhat free press in our country. This is something that has not been seen in any other western country yet. We will see how it works out.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000156;Mughal Ship Raided;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000156;One of the largest mughal ship
column2: carrying a huge amount of treasures has been raided by the English privateer Henry Every. This is the most succesful raid we ever carried out since first used privateers. The Mughal Empire warned us that they'll expel their merchants if another ship of theirs is raided in the future.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000157;Castillo de San Marcos Complete;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000157;The largest fort in the New World has been completed in the northest part of our colonies
column2: Florida. This shall protect it from anyone else of imperialistic goals.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000158;Inquisitions of Evora Begun;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000158;The inquisition of the jewish population of Evora has begun
column2: as the local leading priests declared them heretic. This leaded to a massive holocaust of the local jewish people.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000159;Charles XII Crowned;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000159;Charles XII
column2: king of Sweden has been crowned. He is already being referred to as the Swedish Meteor. Every citizen in our nation
column3: especially the nobility predicts that he'll lead Sweden to a new glory.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000160;Kronor Burns!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000160;The royal palace of Kronor burnt down today with the royal library. Books of great value were destroyed in the fire
column2: last copies of old codexes aswell. This is a grim day for our nation.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000161;Palanquin Spreads;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000161;The use of palanquin has been spreading rapidly in Europe reaching every corner of it. It came to us from the Arabs. Most of the nobles of our country have also adopted it
column2: using slaves to travel around in cities. Of course it is not so appealing to the lower classes.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000162;First Steam Pump;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000162;Thomas Savery
column2: an English inventor and engineer has succesfully created a working steam pump that is more than useful to pump out water from mines. He was given a royal patent to start manufacturing this new invention.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000163;Beards Taxed;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000163;Peter I has issued a tax on anyone who has a beard
column2: trying to break the ties of Russia's eastern origins and westernizing the country. Of course this reform was not popular between the nobles
column3: especially the boyars.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000164;Title of Khalsa Created;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000164;The tenth Sikh Guru
column2: Gobind Sinkh has introduced a new title to the Sikh society
column3: the Khalsa
column4: that is the collective body of all initiated Sikhs
column5: represented by the five beloved-ones and can be called the Guru Panth
column6: the embodiment of the Guru.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000165;Australian Flora and Fauna Collected;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000165;The first complete collection of the different types of living beings in the Australian continent has begun by explorer and scientist William Dampier.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000166;Academy of Sciences Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000166;The Prussian Academy of Sciences has been founded
column2: with well-known polymath Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz as the president. We can expect a boost to our scientific advancement.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000167;World's First Piano;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000167;A new musical instrument has been recorded to be built in the city of Florence. It has multiple keys
column2: which if pressed move a hammer to hit a metal string of different length. It may become popular one day.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000168;The 18th Century!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000168;The morning was just like any other
column2: yet the Sun today shines differently
column3: as it dawned upon a new century of new conflicts
column4: new inventions and a completely new era.;;;;;;x;;

column1: desc_ev_20000169;After the forced seppuku of daimyo Asano Naganori
column2: his bodyguards
column3: 47 samurai
column4: who
column5: with their master dead
column6: are now ronins
column7: have swore revenge on the killer or killers
column8: starting their search on the same day.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000170;Seed Drill Invented;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000170;A new invention
column2: the seed drill has been invented by agriculturist Jethro Tull. This device makes planting seeds way easier
column3: it only needs a horse to pull it
column4: as it sows the seeds in neat rows automaticly.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000171;Earthquake in the Apennines;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000171;An earthquake has shaken the county this morning
column2: leading to many landslides
column3: avalanches. Many people died
column4: and we are still searching the remote farms
column5: villages for survivors. Some of them were completely cut off
column6: so we still can't be sure about the complete damage done.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000172;Kira Yoshinaka Murdered!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000172;Daimyo Kira Yoshinaka was murdered by the 47 ronins who swore revenge. After commiting the act 46 of them commited ritual seppuku
column2: as they completed their only remaining goal on this world.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000173;First Mardi Gras in Mobile;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000173;"Mardi Gras
column2: also Fat Tuesday in English
column3: refers to events of the Carnival celebrations
column4: beginning on or after the Epiphany or Kings day and culminating on the day before Ash Wednesday. Mardi Gras is French for ""Fat Tuesday
column5: reflecting the practice of the last night of eating richer
column6: fatty foods before the ritual fasting of the Lenten season.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000174;First Complete Census;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000174;The first complete census of a region has been carried out in the island of Iceland. Due to its low population it was easier to carry out an experimental census like this. According to it
column2: the population is around fifty thousand on the whole island.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000175;Man in the Iron Mask Dies;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000175;The strange person
column2: who arrived to the Bastille with his face covered by a velvet cloth years ago has died in his prison cell today. His identity was not revealed after all. Some thinks that he was the legal heir of France
column3: some think that he was a disgraced noble. Whoever he was remains a mystery for now.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000176;The Great Storm of 1703;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000176;A great storm has darkened the skies
column2: leaving death
column3: destruction and mayhem behind. The sea levels rose a bit and the rivers flooded. We are still unsure about the damage done
column4: but many people died
column5: that is for sure.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000178;Dublin Gazette Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000178;A Dublin Gazette was instituted by King James II. It was the official newspaper of Britain's government in Ireland. It mostly published notices of government business.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000179;Merchant's Property Confiscated;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000179;A prominent merchant's complete property has been confiscated by the local government of Osaka for conducting deals that are
column2: according to the officials
column3: unbecoming to the merchant class of Japan
column4: turning him into a complete outcast of the country.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000180;Treaty of Union;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000180;With the beginning of a new century and the diplomatic tensions ending between the two countries under the English crown Scotland agreed to unite the two crowns into one
column2: the crown of Great Britain.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000181;Twinings Teahouse Opened;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000181;With the growing income of tea from India and China the first teahouse has been opened by Thomas Twinings
column2: who is also a major tea importer
column3: and is thought to be selling the best quality blends in England.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000182;Mount Fuji Erupts;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000182;The Mount Fuji
column2: that was thought to be dormant until now have erupted once again
column3: raining ash
column4: dust and rocks onto the nearby lands
column5: followed by the lava. We are still not completely sure about the casulties
column6: but it must be thousands of lives
column7: based on the damage done.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000183;St Paul's Cathedral Complete;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000183;A new Cathedral has been built in the location of the old one that was destroyed in the Great Fire. It was constructed in the style of the new English Baroque. Of course
column2: being the largest cathedral in our kingdom
column3: it immediatly became the seat of the Bishop of London and the mother church of the Diocese of London. It is a majestic
column4: great sight
column5: dominating the skyline of London.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000184;New Chamber Musician;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000184;Our royal court has needed a royal musician for a while now
column2: but we found the perfect candidate. A composer who recently got popular
column3: called Johann Sebastian Bach has been selected as royal musician for our court. He seems to excel in composing organ music.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000185;Porcelain Produced in Europe;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000185;Porcelain
column2: a material that was long known only in the form of chinawear
column3: as it could only be produced by the Chinese has been succesfully created in a manufactory in Dresden
column4: leading to the creation of European porcelain and an income drop for the Chinese Empire.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000186;Great Frost of France;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000186;Our people have already experienced cold winters
column2: but this year the winter became harsher than ever before. Many people are dying each and every day from freezings and from the attacks of the wild animals. We can do nothing but wait for spring to come from the warmth of our palace.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000187;Flying Ship?;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000187;A so called airship has been constructed in our city by a certain Bartolomeu de Gusmao
column2: who developed the ideas of Francesco Lana de Terzi. After its construction was finished finished he showed it off at the royal court
column3: flying a ball to the top of the hall of the Casa da India with combustion. He was rewarded for this invetion by being appointed him to a professorhip at Coimbra and making him a canon.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000188;First Copyright Legislation;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000188;The first statute to provide for copyright regulated by the government and courts had been passed in our country by her holy majesty
column2: Anne Stuart. Prior to this a guild has been given the only right to censor
column3: but it was less than effective
column4: leading to the end of the press restriction in 1694. The copyright term was set to 14 years with provisions for renewal.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000189;New Capital City!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000189;With its coastal location and recent expansion the city of St Petersburg has been considered by many to be the de facto capital of our country
column2: but only now was it decided that the capital of Russia shall be moved there de jure aswell.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000190;Pragmatic Sanction;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000190;The Pragmatica Sanctio is an edict issued by Charles VI to ensure that the Habsburg hereditary possessions could be inherited by a daughter. This covered every land owned by the Habsburgs
column2: but not the Imperial Crown
column3: which remained elective. This led to the ultimate succession of his eldest daughter
column4: Maria Theresa.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_200001915;Dynasty of Hannover;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_200001915;With the passing of our queen
column2: Anne Stuart the Stuart dynasty has become extinct leading to another dynasty
column3: the House of Hanover taking the royal throne. This also meant that the state of Hanover became a protectorate of our country.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000191;Solar Eclipse!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000191;Today we experienced something that
column2: according to the court scientists
column3: will not happen again for at least 900 years
column4: a complete solar eclipse. This phenomenon was seen everywhere in Northern Europe from England to Finland
column5: yet we were the first ones to actually document it.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000192;First Jacobite Rebellion;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000192;Our union with Scotland was a good decision according to the most of the people
column2: yet some nobles in Scotland want to restore the old monarchy with James
column3: the second and his heirs. This led to the so-called First Jacobite Rebellion by the supporters of this false king.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000193;Karlsruhe Palace Finished;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000193;"The first building was constructed by Jakob Friedrich von Batzendorf. The city was planned with the tower of the palace (Schloss) at the centre and 32 streets radiating out from it like spokes on a wheel
column2: or ribs on a folding fan
column3: so that a nickname for Karlsruhe in German is the ""fan city"". ";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000194;Banque Generale Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000194;A Scottish economist
column2: who is employed as the Controller General of Finances by Louis XV
column3: called John Law has established the very first central bank in our country
column4: allowing money itself to become the standard mean of exchange.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000195;Kangxi Dictionary Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000195;The Kangxi dictionary was published for the first time
column2: named after the current emperor. It contains about 47000 different characters
column3: with some graphic variants included. It shall become the standardized Chinese dictionary in the upcoming years.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000196;Great Flood;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000196;The recent rains
column2: storms led to the increase of the sea levels and the flooding of the rivers. Most of our country
column3: both coastal and not have been seriously damaged by this event
column4: killing many of our citizens.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000197;Bahrein Belongs to Us!;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000197;Bahrein being an important trading island in the Persian Gulf has a large amount of trade revenue and also is in a strategically important position just off the coast. We must acquire it to further our dominance in the local trade
column2: by sword if necessary.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000198;Casa de Contratacion Moved to Cadiz;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000198;By the late 17th century
column2: the Casa de Contrataci?n had fallen into bureaucratic gridlock
column3: and the empire as a whole was failing
column4: due primarily to Spain's inability to finance both war on the Continent and a global empire. More often than not
column5: the riches transported from Manila and Acapulco to Spain were officially signed over to Spain's creditors before the Manila galleon made port. Recently they moved the Casa from Seville to C?diz
column6: diminishing Seville's importance in international trade.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000199;Corfu Devastated;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000199;The island of Corfu has been devastated as a lightning struck a large gunpowder storage. Most of the people living on the island died instantly or was killed by a building collapse. Barely any survived to tell us exactly what happened...;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000200;Egypt Islamized;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000200;A part of the population of Egypt
column2: especially in the Sudan region has not converted to the one true faith
column3: even after the local administrations ordered them to. So
column4: for the future of an islamic Egypt we have to do everything to fight back these infidels
column5: even if it means killing them all.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000201;Defoe's Robinsion Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000201;Daniel Defoe
column2: a great person of the English Enlightenment has published his new book
column3: titled Robinson Crusoe
column4: that tells about a castaway who was shipwrecked unto an unknown
column5: deserted island and his survival in this situation. Of course this novel immediatly became popular between the youth and also led to many people joining the navy to search for adventures.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000202;First Systematic Census;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000202;The first systematic census in the world has been carried out between our borders
column2: revealing informations about our population and the developement of our settlements. The other nations can only follow in our footsteps now.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000203;Academia Real de Historia founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000203;The Academia Real da Historia has been founded in the city of Lisbon with the goal of furthering scientific developement of our nation and collecting
column2: recording and storing the history of our nation.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000204;Russian Empire Restored;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000204;Tzar Peter the Great has been proclaimed emperor of all Russians
column2: what hasn't happened in centuries. This leads to a new era of the Russian Empire starting once more
column3: leading to nothing
column4: but glory for our great nation.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000205;Table of Ranks Created;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000205;The Table of Ranks was a formal list of positions and ranks in the military
column2: government
column3: and court of Imperial Russia. The Table of Ranks recognized three fundamental types of service: military
column4: civil and court
column5: dividing each into 14 ranks (grades). It determined position and status of everybody according to service (sluzhba) rather than according to birth or seniority
column6: as mestnichestvo did.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000206;First Public Theatre Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000206;The first public theatre
column2: Lille Gronnegade has been opened to every free Danish citizen to visit and enjoy the theatrical acts. Of course primarily the nobles have the time and money for this pasttime
column3: but sooner or later it may be visited by a wider group of audiance.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000207;Peterhof Palace Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000207;"The Peterhof Palace has been built as a series of palaces and gardens located in Saint Petersburg
column2: Russia
column3: laid out on the orders of Peter the Great. These Palaces and gardens are sometimes referred as the ""Russian Versailles""
column4: referring to them using the same baroque style as the French counterpart.";;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000208;Four Seasons Composed;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000208;Antonio Vivaldi
column2: the most likely greatest Baroque composer has composed his so far best series of violin concertos
column3: The Four Seasons. Of course it immediately became popular in the Italian noble courts and even the foreign royal courts of Europe.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000209;St John Passion Debuts;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000209;Johann Sebastian Bach has performed his new sacred oratorio
column2: the St John Passion in Leipzig
column3: where he was responsible for the church music at the St Thomas and the St Nicholas Church. He composed this great work for the Good Friday Vespers.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000210;Christian Missionaries Removed;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000210;We had enough of the teachings of these foreign missionaries
column2: who did nothing but further the trading goals of their countries. According to the Emperor's will we removed each and every christian missionary we could find
column3: by force
column4: if necessary.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000211;Catherine I Becomes Empress;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000211;The previous tzarina
column2: Catherine has become the empress of our nation after the death of Peter the Great. We hope that she will continue the path that was set out for her.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000212;Order of St Alexander Nevsky Instituted;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000212;The Order of St Alexander Nevsky has been founded by empress Catherine in memory of Saint Alexander Nevsky for defending Russia against foreign invaders. It was awarded to citizens who served Russia with honor.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000213;Independent Highland Companied Re-established;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000213;The Independent Highland Companies have been re-established by Field Marshal George Wade
column2: who was appointed as the Commander of the Forces of North Britain. Later this company was mostly referred to as the Black Watch.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000214;Gujin Tushu Jincheng Printed;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000214;66 Copies of the 5020 volume long encyclopedia
column2: the Gujin Tushu Jincheng
column3: the Complete Collection of Illustrations and Writings from the Earliest to Current Times have been printed
column4: what required 250
column5: 000 movable type characters to be cast from bronze.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000215;Swift's Gulliver's Travels Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000215;A book has been publishe by Irish writer and clergyman Jonathan Swift
column2: that parodies the travellers' tales and is a satire on the nature of humanity at the same time.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000216;Handel Composes the Coronation Anthem;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000216;George II has been crowned king of Great Britain. But this coronation was not like the others. The well-known composer Handel has composed an anthem specially for this occasion. The king and the nobility liked it so much that it has been added to the tradition of the crowning ceremonies.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000217;Tabriz Shkaen;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000217;An earthquake has shaken the city of Tabriz leading to countless death
column2: destruction and chaos. We try to help the situation as well as we can
column3: but sadly we can barely do anything.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000218;Copenhagen burns!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000218;Today a fire started in our capital
column2: burning down several residential blocks
column3: killing a great deal of people
column4: and destroying countless old buildings along the way.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000219;Fire in Istanbul;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000219;A fire started in the city of Istanbul killing many people
column2: ruining whole districts by the time we could control it
column3: then put it out. We are still not sure about the damage caused
column4: but it is surely massive.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000220;First Female University Teacher;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000220;The first woman started teaching in the university of Bologna
column2: Laura Bassi at the age of 21. She taught anatomy and was later elected to the Academy of the Institute for Sciences
column3: recieving the chair of philosophy.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000222;Theatre Royal of the Covent Garden Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000222;John Rich
column2: actor-manager of the Duke's Company commissioned an opera
column3: which led to the success
column4: allowing him to build the Theatre Royal at the site of an ancient covent garden. It was designed by Edward Shepherd.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000223;Corsica Regained;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000223;After the recent conflicts in Europe we lost the island of Corsica
column2: but with some diplomatic manouvering we succesfully regained it. Let's just hope that it stays this way.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000224;Cobalt Discovered;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000224;Georg Brandt
column2: a chemist and mineralogist of our nation has succesfully discovered a metal unknown to the world previously. He is the one to do so since the ancient times
column3: leading to an unmatched fame between the scientists of the age.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000225;Theatrical Licensing Act;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000225;The Licensing Act or Theatrical Licensing Act was a landmark act of censorship on the British stage and one of the determining factors in the developement of Augustan drama. The terms of the Act were that from that point onward the Lord Chamberlain had the power to approve any play before it was staged.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000226;Tripical Cyclone Hits the Shores;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000226;A cyclone
column2: stronger than usual has hit our shores
column3: proceeding towards our mainland leaving only destruction behind
column4: killing people and destroying anything that gets into its way.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000227;Teatro di San Carlo Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000227;The Teatro di San Carlo
column2: a new opera house has opened in Naples
column3: located in the central Piazza del Plebiscito and connected to the Royal Palace of Naples. It was commissioned by Charles VII of Naples.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000228;University of Göttingen Founded;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000228;The University of Göttingen has been founded as a comprehenive research university in the city of Göttingen
column2: following the principles of the academic freedom and enlightenment. We can expect a boost to our scienitific output.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000229;Last Medici Dies;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000229;The last male member of the Medici family has died
column2: making the long lasting line of doges extinct. Of course they weren't the rulers of Venice for a long time now
column3: but their mark on our histroy and our cities will allow their heritage to survive well into the future.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000230;Herculaneum Discovered;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000230;An ancient Roman town buried under a dense tuff has been found once again. The volcanic ashes have succesfully kept most of the things intact
column2: so our scientists could find countless motifs of our ancestors which have been since reused on many buildings and furnitures.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000231;First Automaton;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000231;Jacques de Vaucanson
column2: an inventor in our court has created an automated machine capable of playing twelve songs on the flute by itself. Some automatons have been constructed before
column3: but this is the most revoluionary one we have ever seen before.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000232;First Cuckoo Clock;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000232;A so called Cuckoo Clock has been created by Franz Ketterer
column2: a clockmaker of the Black Forest Manufactory. Its speciality is that once it reaches an exact hour a small figure
column3: a cuckoo jumps out of it. It really is a great invention.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000233;Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences Established;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000233;The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences
column2: or Kungliga Vetenskapsakademien has been formed as the first scientific academy of Sweden with the goal to promote the natural sciences and mathematics by naturalist Carl Linnaeus
column3: Jonas Alstromer
column4: Marten Triewald
column5: Sten Carl Bielke
column6: Carl Wilhelm Cederhielm and Anders Johan von Hopken;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000234;Rule Britannia!;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000234;A new patriotic poem has been composed by James Thomson
column2: and was set to music by Thomas Arne. It quickly became the main song of our navy
column3: but the army also started using it.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000235;Stemmatographia Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000235;Stemmatographia
column2: the first secular Serbian-Bulgarian book
column3: written by Hristofor Zhefarovich has been printed
column4: leading to the beginning of thinking of these two nations as the inheritants of the Illyrian heritage and it also promoted panslavism.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000236;Stadtschloss of Eisenach Complete;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000236;A Stadtschloss
column2: a city palace or imperial palace has been completed in the city of Eisenach
column3: improving the overall looks of the city's main square.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000237;Tribes Unite;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000237;Our tribes who were only somewhat joined have finally given up their differences to unite under our flag as one nation to face our enemies and capture more land for the glory of our now united nation.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000238;Great Comet Sighted;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000238;Our nation is the first to sight the great comet that appeared on the sky today. In the past people may have thought that comets bring bad luck
column2: but luckily we live in enlightened times.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000239;Female Spectator Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000239;The first magazine written by women for women has been published for the first time ever.;;;;;;x;;
ev_20000240;Kilts Banned;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000240;The traditional cloth of the scottish people
column2: the kilt has been banned to attempt to bring the various clans fighting against our rule under our control. The only exception that allowed kilts to be worn was in the army
column3: especially the Black Watch regiment.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000241;Durrani Empire Proclaimed;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000241;Our nation has reached its peak with the recent acquisition of more land
column2: leading to our great leader to proclaim himself emperor of the Durrani
column3: effectively beginning the era of the Durrani Empire.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000242;Fire in London;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000242;A fire has started in our great city
column2: leading to many historical buildings' destruction. Luckily apart from a few injuries noone died
column3: the damage done to the buildings is still pretty severe.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000243;Pompeii Discovered;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000243;The ruins of the ancient city of Pompeii have been discovered near the city of Naples. Apparently the buildings
column2: wall paintings have been protected completely by the thick layer of ash and volcanic stone
column3: allowing us to see them in their original glory.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000244;First Income Tax;;;;;;x;;

desc_ev_20000244;After the recent wars and constructions in our country King Louis XV chose to create an income tax of 5% and universally apply it to every person of our country. Of course this upset the nobility way more than the lower classes
column2: as this broke their right not to be taxed.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000245;Westminster Bridge Opens;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000245;A new bridge has been built over the River Thames
column2: linking Westminster to Lambeth. It was painted mostly green
column3: the color of the House of Commons' seats
column4: which is on the side of the Palace of Westminster
column5: nearest to the bridge.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000246;The Ghost Painted;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000246;Maruyama Oko
column2: a great artist
column3: painter of our country has painted what is considered to be one of his great works
column4: based on a traditional Japanese folklore
column5: a female yurei
column6: a ghost in the city of Oyuki.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000247;The First Industrial Revolution Begins;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000247;Countless new inventions have been created in the last few decades
column2: leading to a complete change in our country's economy
column3: and to the creation of the first so called factories
column4: which were manufactories of massive output
column5: using workforces of a way higher amount.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000248;Fire in Stockholm;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000248;Today the citizens of Stockholm experienced one of the worst fires of our cities' history
column2: leading to the death of many people and the destruction of countless historical buildings.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000249;Encyclopaedia First Published;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000249;Encyclopaedia
column2: a general encyclopedia has been published by Denis Diderot and Jean le Rond d'Alembert. It is an innovative encyclopedia
column3: since it is the first to be written by many contributors and the first to lawish attention on the mechanical arts. It is considered to be the peak of Enlightenment by many.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000250;Maria Theresa Thaler Minted;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000250;The Maria Theresa thaler has been minted to the first time ever
column2: and became the first coin to be introduced into the world trade
column3: becoming the standard of the German-speaking countries.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000251;Fire of Moscow;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000251;The city of Moscow was partially burnt down by a larger fire
column2: damaging many residential areas
column3: killing lots of people.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000254;Moscow University Established;;;;;;x;;
desc_ev_20000254;A new high level education facility
column2: the University of Moscow has been established
column3: allowing some of our students to turn their interest to science
column4: and granting us a greater scientific output.;;;;;;x;;

column1: ev_20000255;Lisbon Earthquake;;;;;;x;;
